loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en: Jimmy is a 34-year-old married man with 1 child living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He operates a retail shop and also sells second hand clothes, mainly ladies wear, alongside earning salary as a civil servant. He mainly faces challenges of limited capital and ever changing customer preferences while his dreams are to build a house, set up a poultry project and own a wholesale shop. Jimmy intends to use the loan to buy cement, sand and pay workers who are plastering his house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and pay workers who are plastering his house.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is 52 years old and married with 13 children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land Augustine grows maize, beans, and cassava. He also has cows, goats and chicken. Augustine has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Augustine will expand his farm. His biggest dream in life is to have his own car to transport his crops with.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, 30-year-old resident of Kifamba zone in Makindye, is a widowed mother looking after three children by herself. With the plumbing and ceramics business that she started in 2007, she has been able to send her children to school.
Mariam has a dream of growing her business by opening up other outlets and increasing her stock. Her major challenge is a lack of sufficient capital to boost her business and at the same time look after her family. 

Mariam wants to buy a plot/piece of land in order to build a house for her children. That is why she is requesting financial assistance.

Her neighbours applaud her as a very hardworking, determined and dedicated businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Because Halima is a conservative woman, she asked her husband to take her place in the picture. Halima was born in 1968. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a retired man. One of Halima's sons is studying in his second year for his Bachelor of Space Engineering degree. He is planning to continue his study to find a good job in his field after graduation to start helping his parents financially as they are currently facing a financial crisis. This crisis prevents them from paying his upcoming semester fees. For this reason, Halima applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her son's upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a resident of the Mukuru informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. She was born and raised in the same residence and is the last born in a family of four. Being the last born, she would like to do something to impact the lives of both her and her family members. Lydia dreams of becoming a successful entrepreneur in the future. She seeks a loan to purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets to be put up in Shauri Moyo, a market area. 

Lydia hopes that she will succeed in this area since it is in great need of sanitation facilities. She also is an environmentalist and believes that putting up a sanitation facility in an area with almost none would make it more habitable.

loans.use: To purchase and run two Fresh Life toilets

loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en: Cleophas used his previous loan to buy maize to sell. He is a forty-four-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. He operates a retail shop in order to meet his family's daily expenses since farming is seasonal. His hardships are price fluctuations, inflation and inadequate capital to purchase stock. His personal goal is to educate his children to attain degrees as minimum qualification while his business goal is to expand his business to new markets. Cleophas intends to use the money to buy salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 43-year-old married man. He has six children, ages 20,18,16, 13,10 and 8 years old, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by Kadet officer and he sells quarried blocks. He has been in this business for one year and is located at Matsangoni. In his business he earns a monthly income of KES 10,750. 

Daniel is taking his first loan of KES 20,000, which he intends to use to add stock by buying more blocks. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. Daniel's hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to educate his children and have a bright future.

loans.use: To buy more blocks to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 33 years old and married. He has three children 10, 5 and 3 years old, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer and he is a charcoal vendor. He has been in this business for one year; his business is located at Mpeketoni. In his business he earns a monthly income of Ksh.12,000. He is taking his first loan of Ksh.30,000 which he intends to use in adding stock to his business by buying more charcoal.  

Thomas will use the anticipated profit to expand his business to be a charcoal depot. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to grow his business, educate his children and live a good life.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal to sell to his buyers.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 37 years old, a female, and married. She has one child who is nine years old and she supports three family members . She was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. 

She has a cafe. For seven years, she has been in this business, which is located at Mtangani in Malindi. In her business, she earns a monthly income of 13,070 KES (Kenya shillings). She is taking her third loan of 80,000 KES which she intends to use to add stock to her business by buying wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil, and utensils. 

Agnes paid back her loan of 80,000 KES successfully and will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her future business and family are to grow her business and also educate her child.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, and sugar to make food for her customers

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 35 years old. She is married and supports three children, ages 17, 14 and 10 years. 

Joyce was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet staff member, and she is a taking her first loan from KADET of KES 10,000. She runs a 
café business, which for four years now has been located at Msoloni.  She earns a monthly income of KES.3,000. 

She will use the loan to add stock in her business: wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, sugar, and salt. Also, she will use the anticipated profit to expand her cafe. 

Her hopes and dreams for her future business are to expand her business by making it a hotel and plans to educate and to make sure her children live well.

loans.use: To buy wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil, salt, and sugar to make food to her customers.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is a 40-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. He practices farming, but also operates a retail shop to raise money to support his family.

Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University.

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect his business dreams, while his desire is to expand his farming activities and own a wholesale shop.

Andrew intends to use the loan to buy farm inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a 44 year old single mother living in Masindi, Uganda. She operates a retail shop and with the proceeds she has been able to pay school fees for her children.

The good mother that she is, she wishes to educate her children to attain degrees as minimum qualifications, despite not having sufficient financial means. Her business goal is to own a wholesale shop. Evelyn intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap for resale.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap for resale

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a thirty-six-year-old hardworking woman living in Masindi,Uganda. She operates a retail shop where she mainly sells soft drinks and with the proceeds she has been able to educate her children and buy land for farming. Like most traders she is challenged by inadequate capital and price fluctuation, and her desire is to own a wholesale shop. Betty intends to use the loan to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a married mother of one school-going kid. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Kaliia

texts.en:
Kaliia is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia in the department of Journalism and Mass Communication. Here is her story.

“One of the main goals in my life is to get a higher education, to become a highly qualified person. I am happy to enroll in AUCA this year. I had many reasons to enroll in AUCA, including the notable reasons of methodology, quality of the education, relationship of professors and resources that are available for the students. I had the honor to study at the New Generation Academy of AUCA. This is a unique program that started only this year for only 70 of the most intelligent students and I was lucky to be amongst those. During the year, we have been able to get great experience, skills and preparation for university entrance. While studying at the Academy, I developed even more desire to enroll in AUCA. Unlike all other universities, AUCA is considered to be one of the leading universities in our country and even in all Central Asia.
 
Since I was in school, I did well in those assignments that consisted of interpretation, presentation, constructing reports and stories; and researching some interesting items. I think those things have been very useful for my future career. I think that I became a person who can make people interested in my information and change the way they think about certain subjects. I consider myself to be a good candidate for the Journalism and Mass Communication department. 

Another thing I would like to mention is that AUCA gives many opportunities to all its students. The loan opportunity is among those opportunities. I would like to take this opportunity to apply for a Kiva loan, which is a great chance to be able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fees

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en: Hamisi is a 42-year-old married male. He has three (3) children 18, 17 and 12 years old, respectively, whom he supports. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a KADET officer. He works in a bodaboda (motorbike) business. He has been in this business for three years. His business is based at Kijiwetanga and he earns a monthly income of KSHS 7,000. He is taking his first loan of KSHS 20,000, which he intends to use to repair, service and maintain his motorbike. Hamisi will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to educate his children and have a bright future.

loans.use: To repair, service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Juliah

texts.en:
Juliah is a 42-year-old married woman. She describes herself as disciplined and focused. She operates a clothing store, where she sells clothes to customers.

She explains that her biggest family challenge is a shortage of water. Therefore, she is seeking a loan in the amount of 21,000 KES to buy a water tank to store water for farming activities and her personal use. She hopes that, in the future, she will have easy access to water.

This would be her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan in the amount of 30,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank

loans.name: Scolar

texts.en:
Scolar is a 25-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as humble and focused. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes and furniture. She describes her family challenge to be shortage of water. She will use this 8,700 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan to buy a water tank to store water for domestic use. She hopes that she will have easy access to clean water in the future.

This is Scolar's third loan with SMEP - Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited. Her previous loan of 40,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as aggressive. She operates a retail shop where she sells shoes. She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean water. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy a water harvesting facility that will benefit five family members. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable family. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water harvesting facility

loans.name: Delphine

texts.en: Delphine is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined. She sells clothes to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean water for drinking. She will use the KES 15,170 loan to buy a water purifier and a water dispenser which will benefit five family members. They will be able to access clean water for drinking. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water purifier and a water dispenser

loans.name: Kasaija

texts.en:
Kasaija, 47, is a male Ugandan who is married with six children. He is a farmer who grows mainly sugarcane from which he brews waragi (local gin) for sale.

He works six days a week and nine hours a day and he earns additional income from his motorcycle (boda boda) business

Kasaja has approached UGAFODE for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to complete his residential house since the one he is currently residing in is in a poor state and the size of his family is big. The loan will help him to live comfortably with his household when his house is complete.

He hopes to pay back the loan from the sale of local gin brewed from the sugarcane.

He dreams of completing his house and educating his children. His main challenge is the price fluctuations for his products brewed from sugarcane. However, he is honest and trustworthy and he is even a leader in the village.

loans.use: To complete his residential house

loans.name: Muthina

texts.en: Muthina is a 46-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. She describes herself as focused. She operates a grocery store to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be lack of clean water for drinking. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water tank that will benefit seven family members. They will be able to store sufficient clean water for domestic use. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as resilient. She does tomato farming to earn a living. She describes her family challenge to be that they don’t have a water pump to pump water from a nearby river to do irrigation. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy a water pump and water pipes for pumping water for irrigating their farm. This will benefit 12 members of the family. 

She hopes that in the future, She will have improved her economy and raised her standard of living. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 100,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and water pipes

loans.name: Florence Onjia

texts.en:
Florence is a client pf Finance South Sudan Limited; she came to know about Finance South Sudan through friends and advertisements. She is 40 years of age and married with 2 children. One of her children goes to school. She is a businesswoman who runs a hardware store that sells items like water pipes, bath tubs and toilet seats. She has been operating this business for close to 5 years now. 
Florence is borrowing a loan worth 1000 South Sudanese Pounds to buy more items like water pipes, bath tubs, toilet seats and many other items for business. This will help expand her business more.
The loan will also enable her pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: To buy more items like pipes and other items to sell in her hardware shop

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles used the previous loan to buy pigs to sell. He is 31 years old, married and lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His personal goals are to educate his children, and build a permanent house. 

For the last eight years, he has earned a living by selling pork. He opened this business with some savings he earned while farming. His major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase pigs, since the demand is very high.  His dream is to open his own piggery project. 

Charles intends to use this loan to buy pigs to sell.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a 25-year-old married woman. She has one child who is 6 years old. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a clothes store where she sells clothes. She describes her family challenge to be lack of a water storage facility. 

Victoria will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a water storage facility to store clean water for domestic use which will benefit three family members. She hopes that in the future, she will expand and diversify her business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: tp buy a water storage facility.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben, age 48, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married and charged with the responsibility of taking care of his seven children. He deals in charcoal and silver fish sales. With the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy a land where he now practices farming.

A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the university and expand his businesses to new markets.Ben intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is 40 years old, married to Magdaline, and together they are blessed with three children. He runs a cereals business in Chemundu location, and is served by Kadet Kapsabet branch. He has been in this business for the last five years, and from this business, he gets a monthly income of KES 10,000.

He has borrowed a loan of KES 15,000, which he will use to purchase maize as additional stock in the business. With the anticipated profits, he will pay his children's school fees and make loan payments.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of maize for the business.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en: Annah is 39 years, married to Philip and supports four people in her family. She runs a retail shop in Chemundu on the ourskirts of Kapsabet town and she is served by Kadet Ltd's Kapsabet office. Annah also does some farming of cabbages and carrots. She has been in the retail business for the last 11 years and earns an average monthly income of KSHS 10,000. She plans to use the loan of KSHS 20,000 to purchase wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale. She will use the profits from the retail shop business to repay her loan and to run the retail shop business

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat to sell

loans.name: Santa Rosa Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su primer ciclo, están empezando a trabajar juntas y tienen grandes expectativas, todas son mujeres muy luchadoras y que se unieron con el propósito de que por medio del esfuerzo en conjunto vayan mejorando sus vidas.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna, quien hace crochet y bordados, comenta que desde joven ha aprendido este trabajo, y hoy día es un medio de tener los ingresos para ayudar a su familia. Está muy agradecida, ya que por medio de las capacitaciones que recibe podrá seguir creciendo.
La Sra. Mirna solicita de este crédito para la compra de hilos y telas para seguir con sus bordados y esto le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando por su familia.
texts.en:
This group is in its first loan cycle.  The members are beginning to work together and they have great expectations.  All of them are tough women who got together for the purpose of a joint effort to improve their lives.

One of the members is Mirna, who does crochet work and embroidery.  She learned the craft when she was young and now it is a source of income to help the family.  She is very grateful for the training she has received which will enable her to continue growing.

Mirna is requesting a loan to buy thread and fabric to continue with her embroidery.  This will help her have a concrete business plan so she can improve her income and continue helping her family.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El comité San Isidro pasa al sexto ciclo en forma excelente, el grupo demuestra mucho interés en el programa, demostrando solidaridad y unión. Son de una zona bastante alejada de la ciudad de Curuguaty, todas ellas se dedican a actividades rurales, con lo que pretenden ayudar a sus familias. Quieren también que su comunidad vaya creciendo por medio del esfuerzo que ellas puedan hacer.
Milda cría y vende animales como una forma de subsistir, comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado ya que tiene que estar pendiente de sus animales las 24 horas del día. Pide de este préstamo para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que así podrá seguir con el engorde de estos y venderlos. Agradecen todas las miembros por esta oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Isidro" is going into its sixth loan cycle in excellent shape.  The group demonstrates much interest in the program, showing solidarity and union.  The members are from an area that is quite far from the city of Curuguaty and all of them are involved in rural activities in order to help their families.  They also want their community to grow through their efforts.

Milda raises and sells animals to earn a living.  She says the work is very demanding because she must look out for the animals 24 hours a day.  She is requesting a loan to buy balanced animal feed so she can continue to raise and sell them.  

All the members are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving.

loans.use: To buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: 15 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  15 de Mayo está integrado  por 23 señoras muy trabajadoras, en este ciclo solo 21 de ellas retiran crédito, y las demás solo integran, empiezan  el 4° ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante .Además forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, haciendo la encuesta de eliminación para poder mejorar su economía.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirta quien  se dedica a la venta de empanada , sopa , y todo tipo de comida  y también se dedica a la costura, es una persona que se esfuerza mucho y más aún ahora que es viuda y ella es el sustento de su familia, y la única que ayuda en la casa. Su sueño es poder tener un local propio y así poder tener una mayor comunidad de trabajo.
La Sra. Solicita este crédito para la compra de  insumos  para hacer sus alimentos, como ser carne, verduras, condimentos, etc,lo que le ayudará  a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This group is called "15 de Mayo" and is comprised of 23 hard-working members.  Only 21 of them will participate in this loan which marks their fourth loan cycle in the women's program.  All the members work and help each other to get ahead.  They participate in the poverty elimination program and take the survey to help improve their economy.

One of the members is Mirta who sells empanada (meat pie), soup and all types of food.  She is also a seamstress and works hard, especially now that she is a widow and must support the family with her sole income.  Her dream is to have her own business location and give work to more pèople.

She is requesting a loan to buy food supplies such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, etc. so she can have a firm business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, seasonings, etc. to make food.

loans.name: Karisa

texts.en:
This marks Karisa's fourth loan to finance his business. He will use the money to purchase a motorbike, which will make him access the interior parts of villages where motor vehicles cannot reach with ease.This will be efficient and will boost his income since other public vehicles cannot access such remote areas.
With this loan, Karisa will have been a versatile business man and with the profits from the motorcycle business, he will increase his goats stock.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Soledad Reyes

texts.es: Soledad de 59 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 20 y 16 años de edad. Ella se dedica al comercio. Desde hace tres años logró establecer un pequeño negocio de golosinas (dulces, nachos, galletas, etc.) en su hogar de residencia y es así como poco a poco va saliendo adelante y junto a su esposo llevan la economía del hogar.  Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales, desea construir un pequeño cuarto para cubrir el baño ya que en la actualidad se encuentra al aire libre y no es muy seguro. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, teja, y madera de tal forma que pueda construir lo antes posible el cuarto del baño que tanta falta le hace.
texts.en:
Soledad, 59, lives in her own home with her husband and two children, ages 20 and 16.  She is a merchant and has been working for three years selling snacks (candy, nachos, cookies, etc.) from home.  This is how she and her husband earn a living for the household economy.  

In order to improve her housing conditions, she wants to cover the bathroom since the current one is out of doors and not very safe.  She is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, roofing tiles and wood so she can enclose the bathroom as soon as possible.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, roof tiles and wood to build a bathroom.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a first time borrower client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. She is applying for a loan of 2,000,000UGX. She is married with three children. She resides and does business in the trading centre which is outside Kampala city, neighbouring Kasubi tombs, where she runs an internet café and small salon for ladies in the same building. This has enabled her to get income to look after her children by providing school fees and other necessities.

Alice, who says her café and salon businesses are doing fairly well in terms of sales, goes on to say that she is the only person with an internet café business in the whole trading centre. She is thus assured of daily customers but is let down by inadequate capital to buy more computers and a high power bill. Because of these factors she is applying for a loan to buy new ad efficient computers which will improve her service to customers. Furthermore she says she has plans to educate her children, pay off her loan well, and maintain good relations with her financial institution and the Kiva lenders who are supporting her.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Abubaker

texts.en:
Abubakar, a tea farmer in Kabingo-Kyamuhunga Bushenyi for the last nine years, works six hours a week on the farm.  He also has a saloon which he attends to the rest of the time. Unfavorable weather is his major challenge. Igara Tea factory is the biggest client for Abubakar's tea. 

Abubakar has applied for a loan of 800,000 shillings in order to buy fertilizers to boost the fertility of his farm, which he hopes to expand in the near future. He believes that he will soon have enough money to meet his and his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Benedine

texts.en:
Benedine is 27 years old and supports 3 people. Her spouse provides additional income for the family. They are blessed with one child who is one year old. Benedine has been a photographer for 3 years. Her monthly income being 10,000 Kenyan shillings. 

She has borrowed a loan from Kadet to expand her photography studio. Benedine will use the anticipated profits to invest in a new venture to do with quarrying so as to increase her source of income.This is her second loan from KADET. Benedine paid the previous loan successfully. Her hopes and dreams in the future is to improve the standard of living and invest in her child's education.

loans.use: to expand the photography studio

loans.name: Phillis

texts.en:
Phillis is a 52-year-old woman. She is married to Manyara, and they are blessed with three children. She owns a boutique shop and also sells mattresses in Magina in the outskirts of Limuru. She has been in the business for four years now and gets a monthly income of 17,000 Kenyan shillings. 

This will be Phillis' fifth loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more clothes for selling as well as mattresses. She would wish to expand the business further so as to educate her children consistently. In the future, she wants to buy a plot for her children.

loans.use: To buy clothes and matresses for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is aged forty-one years, and she lives with her husband and four children. All of her children are in school.

Agnes is involved in the trading of second-hand clothes, and she also does agriculture and owns rental units, to earn additional income. She has been in the clothing trade for over twenty years, and she is proud to have gotten a lot from it, such as educating her children.

Agnes is acquiring this loan to buy a stock of used clothing, in preparation for the festive season. She will be ready before the cost of goods goes high. She affirms that her biggest customer base is within markets around her area, and she usually travels on a daily basis. According to her, the biggest challenge is unfavorable weather changes, such as rains, which ruin the business. She is described as a hard-working woman, who has been able to achieve everything from her efforts.

loans.use: To buy a stock of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Amon

texts.en: Amon is twenty years old, married, and supports two members of his family. He runs a tea-selling business in Chemundu location and is served by Kadet Kapsabet Branch. He has been in this business for the last one and a half years. From this business he gets a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000. He has borrowed a loan of Kshs 20,000, which he will use to purchase tea leaves for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves for resale.

loans.name: Nezikokolima Wome's Group

texts.en:
The group is located in a rural area in Rakai district. There are five members in the group who do different activities.

Florence is the mother of five children between 2 and 20 years old. Four of her children go to school.  Florence is a hardworking lady who owns a retail shop along a highway. She primarily sells baked snacks like pancakes and other small items, etc. She works seven days a week for twelve hours each day. She started the business in 2010 because it seemed to generate more income than any other business and yet did not require a lot of capital.

She does farming to get supplementary income. Florence is going to use the loan to buy ingredients such as baking powder, flour, cooking oil and also fire wood. Her dream is to become the leading provider of snacks in the area.

Florence says she has no challenges with her business at the moment. She appreciates the work of lending institutions.

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients

loans.name: Maria  Esperanza

texts.es: María es una mujer que se caracteriza por ser muy trabajadora y responsable. A sus 57 años de edad sigue trabajando en servicios domésticos. Habita en casa propia junto a sus hijos quienes ya son mayores de edad y aportan en la economía del hogar. Para ella lo más importante es la comodidad de sus hijos. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un pequeño cuarto dentro de su propiedad. Con el crédito comprará: lámina galvanizada, madera y adobes (material utilizado para levantar la pared y es hecho a base de masa de barro y paja secada al sol). La clienta expresa tener la capacidad para cancelar las cuotas del crédito.
texts.en: María is a woman who is characterized as being very hardworking and responsible. At 57 years old, she continues to work in domestic services. She lives in her own home with her children who are grown and contribute to the household budget. For her, the most important thing is her children's comfort. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in construction of a small room on her property. With the loan, she will buy galvanized sheeting, wood, and adobe (materials used to put up the wall, made from mud and sun-dried straw). The client says that she has the capacity to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting, wood and adobe to build a room.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 19 years old, and he lives in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, but he did take courses to learn how to repair phones.

He worked in many shops to get some experience. After three years, he decided to open his own workshop. He needs this youth loan to buy computers to save his customers' information. This will help him get organized and develop a good database about them for the future. He wants also to buy repair equipment, which will increase his income and help him to improve the financial conditions of his family.  

Mohammad wants to thank everyone who is helping him to achieve success. He believes that this loan will greatly improve his chances for success.

loans.use: to buy a computer and repair equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Geraldina Del Carmen

texts.es: Geraldina  de 24 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con su madre y una hermana. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica en casa particular desde hace un año y así colabora con la escasa economía de su familia. Con el fin de mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y con mucho esfuerzo han logrado construir una pequeña casa de ladrillo pero a la fecha todavía no han logrado terminarla ya que no cuenta con el efectivo para comprar puertas y ventanas para darle la seguridad necesaria. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de puertas y ventanas que le permitan asegurar su casa para poder mudarse lo antes posible.
texts.en: Geraldina  is 24 years old. She lives in her house with her mother and a sister. She has worked as a domestic employee in a private home for a year and contributes to the family budget. In order to improve her living conditions and with a lot of hard work she has been able to build a little brick house but she still hasn't finished it yet because she doesn't have the cash to buy doors and windows to give the necessary security. She is asking FUSAI for a loan to invest in buying doors and windows that will allow her to secure her house so she can move as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows that will allow her to secure her house.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 37 years old and engaged to be married this year. He has a 12-year-old daughter in the sixth grade. Currently, he works as a teller at a Zoona mobile money outlet in Solwezi, Zambia. He has been working as a teller for three years.  

Understanding the mobile money business well, Martin would like to open his own outlet so that he can earn more income and provide for his child and wife-to-be. He is a big believer in the mobile money industry and the service it provides his community. Many people are in need of accessible and easy ways to transfer money in Zambia, he says.  

The loan will help Martin purchase phone equipment to use at his shop. It will also provide him with needed working capital to service more customers.  He has found a location for his shop and has the support of his current manager in beginning his own business endeavor. His goal is to work hard and grow his first shop so that he can open more outlets and provide better opportunities for his family.

loans.use: to purchase phone equipment to use at his mobile money outlet.

loans.name: Nilma

texts.en:
Nilma is 55 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Nilma is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Nilma has been raising pigs for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es: Heriberto de 34 años de edad  reside en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y tres hijos de 15 años, 10 años y 9 años de edad. Se gana la vida como cerrajero y junto a su esposa mantienen la economía de su hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su casa ya que cuando llueve el agua se filtra por falta de corredor a un costado de la casa. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para construir el corredor que le permita asegurar a su familia y sus pequeñas pertenencias.
texts.en: Heriberto is 34 years old and lives in his own house with his life's companion and three children, aged 15, 10 and 9. He earns his living as a locksmith and with his wife support his home. He wants to improve the conditions in his house because when it rains water comes in due to a lack of a corridor on the side of the house. He is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting and wood to build a corridor that will allow him to secure his family and their belongings.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to build a hallway in his house.

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa is a conservative lady, so she asked her mother to take her place in the picture. Walaa is 23 years old. She lives in a rented house at a sector in Jordan called Salt with her five siblings and her parents. One of her brothers is a student and works at a restaurant, and her mother is retired. 

Walaa is studying for a Bachelor of Accounting. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her study field after graduation to start helping her parents financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis that is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit lives in Vanadzor city. She is 41 years old, and she has two school-aged daughters. Margarit has graduated from Vanadzor State Polytechnic Institute, and now she works at the local school as a teacher. She teaches pupils how to use Information Technologies. At the same time, she has some paid courses at her home with a small group of pupils. As she says, nowadays life is just nothing without modern technologies, and young people are ready to learn more and use more in order to make their work interesting, easy and profitable.

Margarit wants to buy a computer, since it has become just impossible for her to work and teach the skills of Information Technologies without a computer, and for this purchase she asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams.

loans.use: to buy a computer, since it has become just impossible for her to work and teach the skills of Information Technologies without a computer.

loans.name: Cabir

texts.en:
Cabir is 50 and a married man. He has four children between the ages of 22 and 25. He works in a school as a teacher. His salary is not enough to cover his big famliy needs. He additionally earns a living by providing services at a computer saloon such as games and information services. Seven years ago he decided to open his own business doing this work and is successful. Cabir is a very hard worker.
  
Today, Cabir is requesting a loan for the wedding of his eldest son. He needs 1000 AZN to buy gold jewelry for his son's bride.

loans.use: to pay for his son's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es: El señor Sergio vive en la casa de su madre que se encuentra a 45 minutos de la ciudad, es soltero, Sergio es un joven trabajador que se dedica al servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su propio vehículo trabajando como taxi, maneja por las diferentes arterias de la ciudad  en su automóvil que es un poco viejito, últimamente se le daño el motor y no puede trabajar,  el necesita el vehículo en buen estado para poder ayudarle en los gastos de alimentación de su madre y de sus hermanos menores a los cuales ayuda, para esto necesita el préstamo para poder arreglar el motor de su taxi y así continuar ayudando a su madre con la manutención familiar y así mejorara la calidad de vida de esta familia de escasos recursos.
texts.en: Sergio, who is a single young man, lives in his mother's home which is 45 minutes from the city.  He provides a taxi service, using his own car.  he negotiates the different arterial roads of the city in his car which is now getting rather old.  Having damaged the engine recently, he is now unable to work, but he needs to have his vehicle in a good condition so he can buy food for his mother and younger brothers and sisters whom he also helps.  He, therefore, needs the loan to have his taxi's engine repaired so he can continue to help his mother to support the family and to be able to improve his needy family's quality of life.

loans.use: to have his taxi's engine repaired

loans.name: Remsel

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Remsel works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Remsel is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making.

Remsel has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her furniture making.

loans.name: Ledilou

texts.en:
Ledilou is 45 years old and married with three children.

Ledilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like snack foods, juice, soft-drinks, canned goods, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ledilou has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from raising pigs.

Ledilou aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like snack foods, juice, soft-drinks, canned goods, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Vahagn

texts.en:
Vahagn is 22 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city which is in Lori region. Vahagn lives with his mother and brother in a very nice and cute flat. Unfortunately Vahagn’s father died several years ago and now Vahagn and his brother work very hard in order to help their mother to earn a living. Their mother works at the local polyclinics as a nurse. Vahagn works at the very big, nice and modern computer shop in the customer service department. He says he loves his work very much and does it with great pleasure.
 
Vahagn asks for a loan of 300,000 AMD in order to buy a computer which he greatly needs to become more skilled and knowledgeable in his work.

loans.use: to buy a computer which he greatly needs to become more skilled and knowledgeable in his work.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is an ambitious 26-year-old woman. Born fourth in a family of six, her mother and father are not employed. Florence operates a Zoona mobile money transfer outlet at one of the largest hospitals in Lusaka, Zambia, to earn income and take care of her family.  

Florence has been operating her business for 18 months now. This is her second Kiva loan. Her first loan came in April of 2012, right when she was starting her business. The loan was used for her to add to her working capital and have the ability to serve more customers. She also used some of the loan to purchase a directional sign, a few kilometers away from her outlet location, to draw customers to her shop. She says this helped her business receive new customers.  

Currently, Florence is seeking a second loan so she can open an additional outlet nearby in Lusaka. The money will be used as start-up working capital to serve customers and help the business grow. She will also hire a new employee to assist with running the new outlet.  

Florence is hopeful that opening a second shop will double her current profits. She explains how the cost of running a business in the capital city of Lusaka is very expensive. A lot of her revenue goes to paying rent for her shop space at the hospital. Florence is looking to continue to expand her business so she can earn more income and provide better for her family.

loans.use: To open her second Zoona mobile money transfer shop in Lusaka, so that she can serve customers in need of financial services.

loans.name: Rawaa

texts.en: Rawaa is 23 years old. She lives at a sector in Jordan called Irbid with her parents. She has one married brother in the military. Rawaa is studying in her first year for a Masters of Law. She is planning to continue her studies to find a good job in her study field after graduation to start helping her parents financially, as they are currently facing a financial crisis that is not helping them in paying her upcoming semester fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla is a married woman; she has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase eight sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Imelda Esperanza

texts.es: Imelda de 40 años de edad es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 19 años, 15 años, 13 años y 10 años de edad. Tiene dos años de habitar en casa propia y se gana la vida por medio de la prestación de servicios domésticos en casa particulares. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, admirable y responsable. Para ella lo más importante es que sus hijos estén bien y gocen de mejores condiciones a las que ella ha tenido acceso.  Habita en casa propia que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado construir y que aún le hace falta terminar de  una pared. Solicita este préstamo a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para terminar de construir la pared de su casa.
texts.en:
Imelda, age 40, is a single mother of four children, ages 19, 15, 13, and 10.  For two years she has lived in her own house, and she earns her living offering domestic services in private homes.  She is a very hardworking, admirable, and responsible woman.  For her, the most important thing is that her children are well and enjoy better circumstances than those that she experienced.  

She lives in her own house that she managed to build with great effort, and that still is lacking one wall.  She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, and iron to finish building the wall of her house.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, and iron to finish constructing the wall of her house.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 57 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Anita is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Anita has been raising pigs for 30 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Anita is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Natruli

texts.en:
Natruli is 62 years old and a pensioner from the village of Chaladidi. She has a large family. She has a husband, two grown sons, a daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. The family earns a living through agricultural business, cultivating a plot of land where maize is grown. In addition, Natruli and her husband are actively involved in an animal husbandry business and breed four cows and five horses. They also have a small poultry farm and sell eggs from their house. Natruli and her family members work hard but their earnings are still modest and they live in poverty. The family gets a small social assistance from the local government (nearly $ 135 per month).

In order to generate monthly income, Natruli decided to apply for credit and purchase a car. Her younger son, Ramaz, who is jobless at the moment, will start working as a taxi driver. He will earn daily money and cover the feeding and everyday expenses of the family.

Natruli and her son hope the Kiva loan will be helpful for their family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her son to start a taxi business.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman and has five children. She lives at her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past ten years, Mwanamisi has operated an open air food business. Her potential customers are market dwellers and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality of products in the market.

With the KES 50,000, Mwanamisi wants to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice for the business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, and rice for the business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is a conservative woman, so she asked her son to take her place in the picture. Alaa was born in 1962. She is married and has 7 children. 4 of them are in the military. Her husband is a retired man. One of Amal's sons is in his first year studying for his Bachelor of Administrative Information Systems degree. He is planning to continue his studies to work in his field after graduation to start helping his family financially as they are facing a financial crisis, which limits their ability to pay for his studies. For this reason, Amal applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her sons' upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Víctor de 60 años de edad habita en casa propia junto con su compañera de vida y sus hijas quienes ya son mayores de edad.  Él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de zapatos de forma artesanal. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y es así como ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea hacer algunas mejoras en su casa. Solicita este crédito para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos ya que el techo se encuentra dañado y el agua se filtra cuando llueve. Espera poder contar con este apoyo lo antes posible y hacer la mejora del techo.
texts.en:
Victor, age 60, lives in his own house together with his partner and his daughters, who are already adults.  He works designing and selling artisanal shoes. This business is his primary source of income and it is with this that he has managed to keep his family going.  

He lives in very humble conditions, and he wants to make some improvements to his house.  He is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets of metal, wood, and nails, because his roof is damaged and the water enters when it rains.  He hopes to be able to count on this support as soon as possible and make the improvement on his roof.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets of metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Victoria Martina

texts.es: Victoria de 42 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Para ella lo más importante es que sus hijos estudien y puedan tener mejores oportunidades de vida. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas  y junto a su esposo llevan la economía del hogar. Actualmente, el techo de su casa se encuentra dañado ya que tiene mucho tiempo de tenerlo y el agua y el sol lo han deteriorado. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera  para hacer el cambio de techo lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Victoria, age 42, lives with her husband and children in a house she owns. The children are currently studying.  For her, the most important thing is that her children study and can have better opportunities in life.  She works making and selling tortillas, and together with her spouse takes care of the finances of the home.  

Currently, the roof of her house is damaged because they have had it for a long time and the sun and water have deteriorated it.  She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in the purchase of sheets of galvanized metal and wood to change the roof as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sheets of galvanized metal and wood to change the roof of her house.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a divorced woman with seven children. Three are in school and the rest are adults. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

Saumu has operated a coconut selling business for the past ten years, selling from home to her neighbours and passerby. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase two sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu operates a charcoal selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other operators in her business.
 
With the KES 40,000, Mwanatumu wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.en:
Shahodat is a 49-year-old widow who is the mother of 3 children. Some of her children are in school.

She has been selling dried fruits at the local market for 8 years. She has her own garden of apricots. Thanks to her good experience in this field and her influence over her suppliers, she is able to obtain goods for retail, but they bring in little income. This income does not allow her to provide for the needs of her family.She wants to build a new house because her family is large and needs to have big house. Some years ago, she began the building a house. However she does not have enough money to completely finish building it. Therefore, she is asking for a loan of 5000 TJS.  

This loan will help her buy building materials to build her new house. In this way, she will provide a high quality of living for her family and put an end to the problems with her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build her house.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married man who lives in the outskirts of Lyantonde with his family. He is an agriculturalist who deals mainly in cattle rearing as well as trade during certain periods. 

Grace thanks Kiva lenders through UGAFODE who have always supported their ventures. 

Grace is hopeful that he will have enough cows in stock to supply to his customers in the impending festive season. He is hard working.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening.

loans.name: Mardo De Jesús

texts.es: Mardo de 28 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 6 años. Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la prestación sus servicios como Jornalero en una finca de su localidad. Además, vende sabanas en diferentes zonas del municipio. Para él lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que se esfuerza día con día. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para comprar lámina y madera para reparar el techo del corredor de su casa el cual se encuentra dañado. Espera poder contar con el apoyo y hacer la reparación lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Mardo, age 28, lives together with his partner and his 6 year-old child in a house he owns.  For the past eight years he has worked as a day laborer on a farm in the area.  Additionally, he sells sheets in different parts of the town.  For him, the most important thing is his family, and it is because of them that he tries his hardest with each passing day.  

He is asking for this loan from FUSAI to buy sheet metal and wood to repair the roof of the corridor of his house, which is damaged.  He hopes to be able to count on this support and make the repair as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy sheets of metal and wood to repair the roof of the corridor of his house.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy the ingredients that she needed in her food stall. She is a widow now and she is the only one working in the family. That's why the loan is also very helpful in the education of her children. Her income from business assisted in their everyday expenses at home.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan for her to purchase raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Lourdes hopes to have more loyal customers and dreams to give her children a good life and education. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week, to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
This is Josephine, 51, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Pascual, a worker abroad and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Josephine operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Josephine hopes to have a grocery store someday and dreams that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Besik

texts.en:
Besik is 25-year-old young man. He lives with his mother Elene in Batumi. Besik and his mother are unemployed at the moment in spite of having high education. There is a high unemployed rate in the region especially among people under age 40. Some relatives help them to cover everyday expenses. The family lives in poverty, and thus, Besik decided to start his own business. 

All the financial institutions rejected Besik's loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Besik applied for credit from Credo. His request was approved under the framework of Credo's start up loan program, which is joint initiative with Kiva. A loan of $2,000 will help the family to purchase raw materials and start making Georgian Khachapuri (cheese pie). Elene has experience in this field and she will get orders for making Khachapuri. Besik is very enthusiastic and a hard working person with a great desire to progress in life with his mother. This credit will be a great support for the family. 

Besik is thankful to Kiva lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to make Georgian Khachapuri (cheese pie) to sell

loans.name: Armeda

texts.en:
Armeda is 35 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Armeda is borrowing 9500 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Armeda has been raising pigs for four years, and she earns additional income from selling frozen foods.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Chyril

texts.en:
Chyril is 36 years old and married. She has five children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Chyril has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.

Chyril is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jameela

texts.en:
Jameela was born in 1986. She is a widowed woman who lives with her parents at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. She has one sister. 

Jameela has been selling blankets for one year. She started her project with a small amount of her products and found it a good source of income. Now she wants to expand her project by buying a larger quantity of blankets to make better profit and to earn better income to support her and her family in improving their living conditions. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 36 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. Carol works very hard to provide for them.

Carol runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Carol has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods and other groceries. 

In the future, Carol would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine is 38 years old and she lives in Ijevan city with her son. He is already a student of Ijevan State University and in future he will become a specialist of English and French languages. 

Kristine has been divorced since she was very young and her son was very small, but through the years she has managed to bring up a good and kind young man who is very grateful to his mother for her efforts. Since he still studies, the only way of living is his mother’s business income. 

She has a private shop where she sells household goods and food (washing powders, shampoos, toilet paper, diapers, also some food such as bread and butter, dairy products, sausages, cans, sweets etc.). Her shop is very popular and greatly visited. The income from her business helps Kristine both to earn their living and also to pay for her son’s tuition fee. 

Kristine asks a loan of 1,000,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of products for her shop.

loans.use: to buy a lot of goods for her shop.

loans.name: Petronella

texts.en:
Petronella was born in Chingola, a town known for being the cleanest in all of Zambia. She is 22 years old and the second born into a family of seven.  She describes herself as friendly and hardworking.

Petronella provides the service of mobile money transfers in her hometown of Chingola. She says the business gives people the opportunity to access financial services at very affordable rates. 

The main challenge she faces in the business involves working capital. She does not have enough money to serve all her customers and so she can only serve a limited number of customers in a given day. This means the business loses out on potential profits. It is for this reason that she has requested a Kiva loan. The loan will go towards serving her customers by providing working capital.

Petronella has high hopes for the future; she is hopeful that accessing this loan will be the start of significant growth in the business. The anticipated growth will also help her in her personal life. She explains that in her household, it is only herself and her father who have a source of income. Her father is a miner and earns a small amount of money. This puts pressure on Petronella to do well in her work and grow revenues.

loans.use: To allow the mobile money business to serve more customers.

loans.name: Tigranuhi

texts.en:
Tigranuhi is 34 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city. She is married, but she has no children. She has graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical University in the faculty of Russian Language and Literature. Now she works at the school as a teacher. At the same time, at her home, she gives paid courses of Russian Language and Literature and she prepares pupils for the entrance examination. She has many pupils and it is not hard for her to have courses since she lives alone. Her husband is temporally in the Russian Federation.
 
She asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a computer,which she needs in her work very much both for school lessons and her private courses at home.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is 25 years old, a male and single. He supports three children of 5, 3, 1 year old. He was introduced to KADET Ltd by a Kadet officer. He has a tailoring shop in Malindi which he has operated for four  years now. In his business he earns a monthly income of Ksh.7,000. 

Juma is taking his first loan of Ksh.20,000 which he intends to use to purchase materials, zips, sewing thread and canvas. Juma will use the anticipated profit to expand his business. His hopes and dreams for his future business and family is to expand his tailoring shop and live a better life.

loans.use: To purchase materials, zips, sewing thread and canvas to use in his business.

loans.name: Milkah

texts.en:
Milkah is 38 years old and married to Nick. They are blessed with seven children, ages between 18 and 5 years, whom they both support. Milkah runs a cosmetic shop.She has been in this business for the last six years. From this business, she gets an average monthly profit of KES 10,000.
 
She has borrowed a loan of KES 30,000. With this loan, she will purchase cosmetics including hair products, skin products, ladies' perfumes and skin-care products for stock and resale. With the anticipated profits, she will increase her business stock and repay her loan as well as educate her children.

Her dream is to give the best to her family as well as best education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics including hair products, skin products, ladies' perfumes and skin-care products for stock and resale

loans.name: Yeanoh

texts.en:
Meet 49-year-old Yeanoh from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with eight children. 

She began her business because she wants to take care of her family. In 2001, Yeanoh established her general stock business. She works at the business nine hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Yeanoh requires a loan in order to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family's welfare. In the future, Yeanoh plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks and pure water.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan was born in 1982. She lives with her husband and six children at a sector in Jordan called Dairalla. Her husband is a retired man who currently works as a security guard. 

Hanan has been selling blankets for one year. She started her project with a small amount of blankets and found it a good source of income. Now she wants to expand her project by buying a larger amount of blankets to make better profit and to earn better income to support her husband in improving their living conditions and in covering their children's needs. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more blankets for her business.

loans.name: Jeresom

texts.en:
Jeresom was able to buy cows using the previous loan. He has just sold off one of them and gotten payment for his milk supply and paid off the loan. 

He now wants another loan to top up on the money he has to buy more cows, which he will rear and sell during the festive season. He thanks the Kiva lenders for the tremendous support towards their projects.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Charity Clement

texts.en:
Charity Clement is 38 years old, and is married with five children, three of whom attend school. 

She has been in this business for over four years; she works alone and sometimes is assisted by her eldest son. She does not incur much cost in transportation, due to the availability of supplies in the nearest big stores within the Darsalam market in Yei. 

She has received one loan with Finance (SS) Limited, and paid it successfully. 

With the new funding, she intends to fully stock her shop for the lucrative Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy soap, washing powder, salt, and onions

loans.name: Debora Piye

texts.en: Debora is thirty-two years old and is married with four children, three of whom attend school. She has been in this business for five years. She has two employees working for her, preparing food and washing dishes. Her spacious restaurant attracts a lot of customers during lunch hours and has the potential for growth. She has served three loan cycles with Finance (SS) Limited and paid very well. With additional funding, she intends to add more tables and seats to attract more customers.

loans.use: To buy flour and drinks.

loans.name: Ishatu

texts.en:
Ishatu is 28 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school. She operates a pharmacy in Waterloo in the western rural area in Sierra Leone, which she has been doing for 13 years.  She sells malarial drugs, cholera drugs, and blood syrup within her community.  Her main challenge is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Ishatu is requesting a loan from BRAC Sierra Leone, which she will use to buy more malarial drugs, cholera drugs, and blood syrup to sell. The extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and pay her children's school fees. In the future, she would like to open a big clinic in her community.

loans.use: to purchase malarial drugs, cholera drugs, and blood syrup

loans.name: Gazanfar

texts.en:
Gazanfar is married, 43 years old and has two children. One of them is entrant and the other will go to 10 class. They are live in Mastaga village of Baku region.

This is Gazanfar's third loan from the Komak organization. He is now requesting a loan in the amount of 1,900 AZN to be used to repair his greenhouse.

He is thankful to Komak and Kiva for the help and hopes that, with this loan, he can increase his business.  In the future he wishes to buy new land for planting.

loans.use: to repair his greenhouse.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Nana did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. She sells firewood in Funko near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for four years. As a single mother with three children, Nana uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Nana is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase an increased amount of firewood, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of firewood

loans.name: Ramon Rafael

texts.es: Ramón de 28 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos de 4 años y  un mes de edad. Ramón  es quien sostiene la economía de su hogar. Desde hace 5 años se gana la vida como panadero y es así como logra llevar el sustento diario a sus hijos. Con el fin de dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar el techo de la casa ya  que a la fecha se encuentra dañado y cuando llueve se filtra el agua.
texts.en:
Ramón is a 28-year old man who lives in his own house with his life partner and their children, who are 4 years old and 1 month. Ramón supports their household and has been working as a baker for 5 years. This is how he provides his children with what they need daily.

He has decided to request this loan to FUSAI to improve the housing conditions of his family. He will use the loan to buy galvanized layers and wood to repair the ceiling, which is currently damaged and lets the water in when it rains.

loans.use: to buy galvanized layers and wood to repair the ceiling of his house.

loans.name: Boucotte Sindian Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe de 4 femmes fait partie du banc villageois créé le 29 Mars 2002. C'est des femmes qui mènent les mêmes activités. Madame Honorine qui est la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est mariée. Elle est âgée de 41 ans et mère de quatre enfants dont deux filles. Avec une expérience avérée d'une quinzaine d'années Madame Honorine ne cesse de connaitre des résultats évoluer dans ses activités. Elle porte beaucoup d’intérêts à ce prêt qui lui permet de mieux développer ses projets. Les revenus servent à améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group of 4 women are part of the "banc villageois" which was formed March 29, 2002. It is made up of women who participate in the same business.

Honorine, pictured on the right side of the photo with her hand raised, is the representative of the group. She is married, 41 years old, and the mother of 4 children, 2 of whom are girls. With over 15 years of experience, Honorine has been consistently seeing benefits from growing her business. She is very eager for this loan which will allow her to better expand her offerings. She will use the profits to improve the living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase palm oil and peanut paste

loans.name: La Victoire Group

texts.fr: La cliente  Mulasi  est une secrétaire du groupement de crédit « La victoire », entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 39 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint un peintre. La cliente est  une vendeuse des pommes de terre. Elle installe ses produits  au marché public, parfois à son domicile.  Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 6 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité.  Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 4 sacs de pommes de terre.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une jolie maison.  Les impayés, les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité.  Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mulasi is the secretary of the borrowing group "La victoire" ("the victory") and is an experienced entrepreneur. She is a dynamic 39-year-old mother of 3 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a painter. 

Mulasi is in the business of selling potatoes. She sells her products in the public market and sometimes from her home. She began her business with help from her husband, and then later received a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She has been in business for 6 years. This new loan will allow her to purchase 4 bags of potatoes.
