Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 39-year-old Jegbeh from Waterloo 2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married with seven children between the ages of 3 and 22 years. Two of her children attend school. She started her business to get money for the daily survival of her family.
 
Jegbeh runs a cookery business. She sells cooked food within her area. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business twelve hours per day and six days per week.   Jegbeh says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Jegbeh has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil, and rice to prepare food for her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy food commodities like cooking seasoning, oil, and rice to prepare food for her cookery business.

loans.name: Kuriya

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Kuriya from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with four children between the ages of 14 years and 25 years.  She began her business because she wanted to empower herself. In 2005, Kuriya established her fast food business.  She works at the business from 8:00 am to 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Kuriya requires a loan in order to purchase more items like pure water, biscuits, flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Kuriya plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like pure water, biscuits, flour, sugar and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay is 38 years old and single. She sells office supplies, such as tape, calculators, bulbs, etc. Her profit is 100 AZN a month. She does not have enough funds to buy goods. Even though it is a small business, she has a lot of customers and wants to expand her business. 

Gunay is requesting her third loan from Aqroinvest for 1,700 AZN, which she will use to buy more goods. She believes this loan will have a positive impact on the expansion of her business

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Arayik

texts.en:
Arayik is 31 years old and he lives in the village Avshar which is in Ararat region. Arayik is married and he has two children. In his native village Arayik lives with his wife, children and parents. His father works as a driver, his mother is a baker.

Arayik works as a gardener and the only person who is not employed outside the home is his wife, who takes care of their children and their house. Besides his work Arayik is engaged in farming and agriculture and all his family members help him in it. In their farm they have a cow, three piglets and twenty chickens. Their fruit garden is just unbelievably beautiful and bright and it is colored by the harvest of apple trees, pomegranate trees and plums. 

Arayik also cultivates wheat on his plot of land. Since his family is big and problems are a lot without farming income, it would be impossible to live on his salary. So through the farming Arayik perfectly provides his family.

He is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for winter and also some wheat seeds.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for winter and also some wheat seeds

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is a 33-year-old married man .He is  a market vendor and sells different kinds of goods like shampoo, flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. He has 8  years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and the demands of his clients..

The food products  Elchin   sells are very popular among people and in high demand. His monthly profit from selling foods is 200 AZN. His   brother   is helping him  to purchase products and bring them to the shop. This is the sole financial income in his   family. He is a very successful entrepreneur because of his  good location, in the central bazaar of his  home city.

Elchin applied for a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover his  customers` demands.

loans.use: to purchase more food products

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is 40 years old and he lives with his family in the frontier village of Zangakatun which is in the Ararat region. After finishing school, Yurik took part  in both the war to defend his native village and the war of Nagorno Karabakh. After that, he got married and he has a very nice daughter. 

Now Yurik is seriously engaged in framing and agriculture. He breeds in his farm two cows, three calves, two piglets, and fifteen chickens. His wife helps him in farming activities greatly, and right from their house she sells milk, cheese, eggs and meat. They also have a very nice fruit garden with different and sweet sorts of apples. They sell their garden harvest at the local wholesale market. 

Yurik wants to increase the number of his farm cattle, and he asks for a loan of 950,000 Armenian drams. He plans to buy a cow and several calves.

loans.use: to buy a cow and several calves in order to increase the number of his farm cattle

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El cliente reside en la ciudad de Libertad.  Empezó con esta actividad en la playa de Santa Rosa, comprando pescado para venderlo a los comerciantes.  Desde ahi, decidió ampliar su mercado e ir a vender a Guayaquil.  Trabaja solo, todos los días desde temprano en la mañana.  Es soltero pero tiene novia y 3 niños menores de edad.  A futuro desea tener su propio vehículo para poder transportar el pescado.  Ahora necesita el crédito para la compra de albacora, bonito y otros tipos de pescado para su comercialización.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in the city of Libertad.  He began his business on the beach in Santa Rosa by buying fish to sell to the merchants.  Since then, he decided to expand his market by selling in Guayaquil.  The borrower works alone every day, starting in the early hours of the morning.  He is single, but he has a girlfriend and three young children.  In the future, he would like to have his own vehicle for transporting fish.

For now, the borrower needs a loan so that he can buy albacore tuna, bonito, and other types of fish that he can sell.

loans.use: to buy albacore tuna, bonito, and other types of fish that he can sell.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is predominantly an agriculturalist who rears cows and also does subsistence farming. He concentrates more on cattle-rearing because there is demand for cattle by the people that take them to the city for slaughter. He is confident that if his stock increases then he will make more profits and become a big cattle trader who can load a full truck to the city. He is hard-working.

loans.use: To buy young bulls

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: This is 46-year-old Ibrahim from the Goderich Tenbehtown area in Freetown. He is married and the father of four children who are between 8 years and 22 years old. He started his lumber business to improve his living standards and conditions. He has been running this business for eight years and works at the business every day, 12 hours per day.  He says that the main challenge he faces is the problem of transporting timber from province to city. Ibrahim has requested a loan to buy more timber to expand his business. The extra income from this loan will allow him to repay his loan and pay his children's school fees. In the future, he plans to go into the furniture business and appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy more timber to expand his business.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson lives in Malindi, in the northern part of the Kenyan coast. He is widowed and runs a motorcycle business in Malindi. He has been in this business for the last one and a half years and the business has been growing. 

He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to repair his motorcycle. The challenges that he faces in the business are weather and the low season. He hopes that his business will become stable so that he can improve his living standard.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Rhonda

texts.en:
Through this first Kiva-provided loan, Rhonda successfully moved her salon. The move was good for her business, and she has succeeded in maintaining customers and gaining new ones. In her current location, there are other beauty salons, but Rhonda's professionalism and high quality work has succeeded in differentiating her from the competition. She has even gained customers from the other salons.

Rhonda needed this new loan to allow for additional renovations and to purchase a salon mirror, artificial nail application and maintenance materials, and additional cosmetic treatments.

The new station and mirror will assist in further emphasizing the difference of Rhonda's salon from her competition. Rhonda wants to continue to see her business grow. Eventually she wants to include a wide variety of beauty treatments and programs.

loans.use: To purchase a chair and materials needed for artificial nails, a treatment bed, a hair styling station, and a salon mirror.

loans.name: Dannys Solanlly

texts.es: Dannys, a sus 33 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como comerciante independiente, vendiendo mercancía desde hace 6 años, esta actividad la aprendió de una amiga y de su hermana mayor quien realiza la misma labor; sus principales clientes son sus familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside, de esta manera genera los ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía de su hogar. La cliente es una mujer activa y emprendedora, que siempre va buscando nuevas alternativas para seguir progresando; por ello solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (ropa, accesorios, cosméticos, entre otros); así podrá abastecerse para satisfacer la demanda de productos que aumenta con la temporada de navidad que se aproxima, época en la que se ven beneficiados sus ingresos personales. Dannys manifiesta que su principal objetivo con la labor que realiza, es poder ahorrar ya que en un futuro sueña con abrir su propio taller de confección, pues le apasiona este arte y ve en él una buena fuente de ingresos para seguir avanzando y poder disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dannys, at 33-years-old, makes a living as an independent merchant selling goods for 6 years. She learned this activity from a friend and her older sister who do the same work. Their main customers are family, friends, and residents from the area where she lives. She generates enough income to contribute to the economy of her home. The client is an active and enterprising woman who is always looking for new ways to keep progressing, hence, she is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (clothes, accessories, cosmetics, etc.) so she can stock up to meet the demand for products that increases with the approaching Christmas season, a time that is beneficial for her personal income. Dannys says that her main objective for her work is to be able to save and, in the future, she dreams of opening her own clothing shop, as she is passionate about this skill and she sees it as a good source of income to move forward and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale merchandise (clothes, accessories, cosmetics, and others).

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en:
This is Amadu, who is in his late 40's and is from the Goderich Tengbehtown  area in Freetown. He is married with three children between the ages of 1  and 9 years. He was a fisherman, but because of cold weather conditions, he decided to started a business so he can take care of his family's welfare.  

Amadu runs a general store; he sells drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste. He has been running this business for eight years. He works at the business every day, twelve hours per day.  He says that the main challenge to his business is price inflation.

Amadu has requested a loan in order to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste. The extra income from this investment will allow him to pay his installments and have his daily meal. In the future, he plans to open another shop. He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase items such as drinks, cigarettes, pure water, and toothpaste

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 39-year-old married man from Qalqilia city. He lives with his wife and six children (two sons and four daughters) in a small house in the city. Wael works as an employee in the public sector where he gets a very low income. 

For the past ten years, Wael has been working also at raising sheep on a small farm. It is a good project and supports part of the expenses for the family. 

Wael took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more sheep to raise on his farm. This will increase his productivity and also his income. Wael appears in the photo on his farm

loans.use: to buy more sheep to raise on his farm

loans.name: Khader

texts.en:
Khader is 49 years old and married, and he lives in Bethlehem city. He is the father of six sons and one daughter. 

Khader has been working in a carpentry workshop for many years, and he has gained very good experience in this field. Two years ago, Khader decided to open his own carpentry workshop. It is a good business and earns a good income. 

Khader would like to improve his project and buy all the needed materials and equipment.  He has taken a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more materials for his carpentry shop and some equipment to improve his production. This will increase his income and improve his family's living conditions. 

Khader appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more materials for his carpentry shop and some equipment to improve his production

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 32 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos en la zona rural de Palo Blando de Pucará a donde su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores a dos horas de la ciudad e Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Hace dos años se dedica a la venta de salchipollo y salchipapas su local está ubicado frente a la comisaria de Pucara, además con la ayuda de sus hijos se dedican a la cría de aves de corral, que luego los ofrecen a sus clientes.

Ella es una mejer emprendedora que ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de gaseosas y adicionales para su negocio de alimentos y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para su familia.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 32 years old and lives with her three children in the rural district of Palo Blando de Pucará.  This community, which is known for agriculture and trading small animals, is located two hours away from the city of Jaén.  It is located in the region of Cajamarca, which is in the northern mountains of Peru.  

Tomasa has been selling “salchipollo” (sausages and chicken) and “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes) for two years.  Her stand is located in front of the police station in Pucara.  In addition, her children help her with raising poultry that is eventually served to her customers.  

Tomasa is an enterprising woman who is requesting a loan of 1,500 PEN so that she can invest in the purchase of sodas and additional supplies for her food business.  This will help her generate additional income for her family.

loans.use: to buy sodas and additional supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Maria Mariana

texts.es:
María Mariana es una señora  muy trabajadora de 47 años de edad, casada, y madre de 3 hijos, ella vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos 1 menor de edad que está estudiando la primaria y una hija adolescente que le ayuda en los que aceres del hogar. El grado educativo de María es primaria incompleta la cual no pudo terminar por más esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres como ella también ya que desciende de una familia de escasos recursos económicos.
María desde  hace 7 años  se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo particularmente al cultivo de café; Esta actividad la aprendió con sus padres ya que desde niña la llevaban a trabajar (cortar café) a fincas de otras personas para poder sobrevivir.
El terreno donde hoy en día tienen su finca lo adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo es por eso que ella se siente motivada y desea ver su terreno cultivado, el cual está ubicado a 4 kilómetros de su casa, ella todas las mañanas junto a su esposo caminan 25 minutos para llegar a  su finca donde trabajan arduamente  para  limpiar y cuidar su cultivo ya que temen que alguna plaga se los dañe, sin embargo ellos son optimistas y afirman que obtendrán una excelente  cosecha de café.
Por lo que  ella necesita financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas para dar asistencia técnica a su cultivo de café como ser compra de abono, foliares, fertilizantes entre otros.
 Ella sueña hacer crecer su finca, sembrar y cultivar plantación nueva de café  ya que es la única forma de asegurar el futuro de su familia ya que la situación económica cada día es precaria; además ella enseñara a sus hijos a trabajar para que sean personas de bien y valoren el esfuerzo que sus padres hacen por salir adelante y tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
María Mariana is a hard-working woman of 47 years of age.  She is married and mother of three children. Two of  the children live with them. One is studying in primary school and the other is an adolescent who helps with the household work. Maria did not complete her primary school studies as much as her parents tried. Her family had very modest economic resources.

For the past 7 years Maria has worked alongside her husband farming, in particular growing coffee. She learned this activity as a child who accompanied her parents at work (harvesting coffee) on other people's plantations in order to survive. 

She worked very hard to obtain her plantation. This is her motivation and she wants to see her land under cultivation. It is located 4 kilometers from her house and every morning her and her husband walk the 25 minutes it takes to get to the plantation. They work hard to clean and care for their crops as they are worried about infestations. However they are optimistic and affirm that they will have an excellent harvest.

For this reason Maria needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies to apply technical support for her coffee crops buying fertilizer, foliar spray, manure etc. She dreams of expanding her plantation as this is her only way of securing her family's future given that each day's financial situation is precarious. Also she will teach her children to work so that they can be good people who value the efforts of their parents to get ahead and lead a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to assist her coffee crops.

loans.name: Maria Otilia

texts.es:
Doña María Otilia es una mujer de 47 años de edad muy luchadora, con muchos sueños y muchas fuerzas la cual es viuda y madre de 4 hijos, los cuales 2 ya son mayores y están en hogares a parte, el tercer hijo vive con un tío y la última hija es estudiante de primaria en una escuela de la comunidad siendo ella la única que vive con ella. Con ella también viven sus padres y ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo la cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo y esfuerzo de sus padres. Doña María Otilia aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura desde muy pequeña ya que ella apoyaba a sus padres en sus cultivos de café por lo que en la actualidad tiene 10 años de ejercer dicho rubro. La tierra que trabaja fue una herencia de sus padres la cual está ubicada a 3 kilómetros de distancia de su casa de habitación. Sus clientes son lo diferentes compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un producto de calidad.
Ella sueña con tener una casa en mejores condiciones, poder sacar a su familia adelante y poder también cultivar una manzana de tierra con una mejor variedad de café la cual sea más atractiva para sus clientes y demás. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Otilia is a very determined 47-year-old with many dreams and many strengths. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children, 2 of which are older and in their own homes. Her third child lives with an uncle and her youngest child is an elementary school student in a school in her community. She is the only child that lives with her. Her parents also live with her. She has a full primary education which she completed thanks to the support and efforts of her parents. Doña Maria Otilia learned the industry and trade of agriculture from the time she was very small. She supported her parents with their coffee crops and she now has 10 years of experience practicing this work. Her land was an inheritance from her working parents and is located 3 miles away from her home. Her clients are different buyers who come to the area looking for a quality product. 
She dreams of having a house in better condition to get her family ahead. She also wants to cultivate an acre of land with a better variety of coffee which is more attractive to customers and others. So she is requesting this loan to improve her crops by giving them better agricultural inputs such as manure and fertilizer formulated for coffee plants and fungicides to avoid contamination of insects and diseases.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs to attend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: Emzar

texts.en: Emzar is a 51-year-old married man. He lives with his wife, son, and mother in a small village of Telavi district. Emzar and his son work as drivers on an emergency car, and each of them gets 212 GEL per month. His wife works as a nurse at a local hospital and gets 240 GEL per month. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Emzar decided to start a family business and requested a loan. He couldn’t receive a loan from the local financial institutions because of their requirements to have business experience or stable revenue. However, he has been able to receive a loan through the Start Up program, which is a joint product of Kiva and Credo. The program allows Emzar to start or re-start a business. He requested a loan of 3,000 USD to begin a grocery store. With the received credit he will renovate a space, which he already has, and he will purchase grocery inventory. The family will be involved in their own business and will have stable income.

loans.use: to open a grocery store

loans.name: Mirna Luz

texts.es:
Doña Mirna Luz es una señora muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante ama de casa y agricultora de 34 años de edad la cual es casada y madre de tres que ayudan a trabajar en sus cultivos de café apoyando a su padre en muchas actividades. Doña Mirna Luz aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura gracias a sus padres ya que desde muy pequeña los apoyaba en el mantenimiento de sus cultivos de café. Sus cultivos están ubicados en su misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando aproximadamente a una hora de camino y la tierra que cultiva es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres. Doña Mirna Luz en su juventud no pudo estudiar ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos por lo que no alcanzaba los ingresos para apoyarle en sus estudios más que para cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar como alimentación, vestimenta, medicina y con muchas restricciones. 
Ella sueña con ver a sus hijos en un mejor futuro, con mejores oportunidades, mejores condiciones de vida para que puedan ser apoyo en sus familias aportando todo lo necesario, comprar un terreno para cultivar una mayor cantidad de café y una mejor variedad. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Doña Mirna Luz is a very enterprising woman eager to get ahead. She is a 34-year-old housewife and a farmer who is married and a mother of three children who help work on their coffee crops and support their parents in many activities. Doña Mirna Luz learned the industry and trade of agriculture from her parents since she was very young and supported them in maintaining their coffee crops. Her crops are located in the same community where she lives. She must walk an hour to the land she cultivates which is her own thanks to an inheritance from her parents. Doña Mirna Luz could not study in her youth because her parents were low-income and did not have enough income to support her in her studies and to cover basic household needs such as food, clothing, and medicine within their means. 
She dreams of seeing her children have a better future, better opportunities, better living conditions, and for them to be supported by their family by providing everything they need. She also dreams of buying land to cultivate more coffee and a better variety. She now requests a loan to improve her crops by giving them better agricultural inputs such as fertilizer and manure formulated for coffee plants and fungicides to avoid contamination by insects and diseases.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en: Meet 32-year-old Alimatu from the Goderich Tengbehtown area in Freetown. She is married and has one child who is 10 years old. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling various food items to people who live in her community. She began this business because she wants to create a permanent source of income to support her child, and works from 7:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m., 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge her business faces is inflating prices for goods and for storage facilities. She is requesting a loan to buy more cooking oil, flour and seasonings. She hopes that the extra income she earns from this loan will allow her to become more successful and pay her children school fees. In the future, Alimatu plans to build her own shop and become a distributor of food stuffs. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, flour and seasonings.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is a farmer from Lusaghbyur village in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife and two little daughters (6 and 4 years old). He is employed in the private sector, however, his salary alone is not enough to meet the needs of his family. 

Artyom is engaged in cattle breeding, in breeding livestock (sheep and pigs), in agriculture, and in the cultivation of wheat. He sells the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is the most important source of the family’s income. 

To be able to more effectively meet the growing needs of his family, Artyom needs a loan of USD $3,000 to purchase two cows, a calf, some forage for cattle, and to make previous credit repayments. 

He had already taken a loan from a local financial institution before, but unfortunately wasn't able to pay it back. However, thanks to his recent hard work, Artyom was able to run his agribusiness in a sustainable way, ensuring that he will be able to cover the monthly payments. So he has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history, and have no access to credit products. 

Artyom and his family will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase two cows, a calf, some forage for cattle, and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Zina

texts.en: Zina is 57 years old and lives in Vanadzor city, in the Lori region. She is a wise and greatly-respected woman who graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogic Institute's department of Russian Language and Literature. Since graduating, she has become greatly interested in teaching and working with children so they can learn as much as is useful for them. That is why she has become a teacher of Russian Language and Literature, working at the local school where she is very pleased and satisfied with her work. Zina is married and has three grown children. She considers herself a happy and lucky woman since she is greatly beloved and respected by her family, her pupils and colleagues. She also gives paid courses in Russian Language and Literature at her home and prepares pupils for entrance examinations. She is asking for a loan for 500,000 Armenian drams to buy a computer and some literature that she greatly needs during her courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and some literature for her courses.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz, habita en el municipio de Soledad, allí  realiza dos actividades, por un lado vende comidas rápidas y por el otro confecciona ropa. Ella realiza su negocio de venta de comidas rápidas, de jueves a domingos y desde las 6 de la tarde a 1 de la mañana, mientras el de costura de vestidos, la otra parte del tiempo y de acuerdo con los pedidos de su clientela. 
En el mes de Diciembre los productos alimenticios que vende Beatriz, tienen mucha demanda y para esa temporada, ella se prepara con una mayor producción para vender mucho más y aumentar sus utilidades. Con su negocio de comidas rápidas, ha ido de menos a mas, aun recuerda como hace algún tiempo, elaboraba todos los productos de una manera incipiente y sin carruaje de preparación y exhibición y hoy tiene un equipamiento, que le permite estar más cómoda en su tarea y dejar ver su oferta, impulsando la venta a su mercado. Sus mayores consumidores son los vecinos de su barrio y transeúntes, a quienes les vende de contado. Beatriz al realizar sus compras, siempre tiene en cuenta hacerlas a mayoristas que le ofrezcan los mejores precios, para lograr aumentar su competitividad en el mercado. Su meta es hacer crecer este negocio y por eso ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará embutidos, harinas, azúcar, salsas, aditivos, aprovechando que se acercan las vacaciones de fin de año, y los estudiantes son sus mejores compradores. Con la inversión de este crédito, Beatriz, planea abrir su negocio de lunes a domingos, para incrementar sus ventas y así mismo hacer de su credikiva la mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Beatriz lives in the municipality of Soledad where she performs two jobs, selling fast food and making clothing. She does her business of selling fast food from Thursday to Sunday from 6 pm to 1 am while sewing dresses the other part of the time and according to the orders of her clientele. 
In the month of December, the food products sold by Beatriz are in high demand. For the season, she prepares an increased production to sell more and increase her profits. 
In her fast food business she has seen sales increase from less to more. She remembers that, some time ago, she made all of her products in a fledgling way and without a cart for preparation and display. Now she has a facility that allows her to be more comfortable in her work and display what she has for sale, boosting her sales in the market. Her best customers are the residents of the neighborhood and passersby who pay in cash. When she is shopping, Beatriz always buys from wholesalers that offer the best prices so she can be more competitive in the market. Her goal is to grow this business and, therefore, she has sought a Kiva loan as her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy sausages, flour, sugar, sauces, and additives, awaiting the approaching New Year's holidays when students are her best customers. With the investment of this loan, Beatriz plans to be open for business Monday to Sunday to increase sales and make her Kiva loan the best investment.

loans.use: to buy sausages, flour, sugar, sauces, and additives.

loans.name: Mane

texts.en:
Mane is a young and prosperous teacher, 38 years old, and she lives in Vanadzor city, which is in Lori region. 

Mane is married and she has two lovely, school-aged children. Mane has graduated Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute, in the faculty of Methodology of Elementary Schools. Now she works at the local school as a teacher of elementary classes and, at the same time, she gives paid individual courses of Armenian Language and Literature. She also prepares pupils for entrance examinations. She says that she enjoys her work with children and she never gets tired of their endless questions, to which she always answers with patience and care. 

Mane asks a loan of AMD 500,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy a computer and very necessary methodological literature, which she needs very much in order to pass her courses and be more productive.

loans.use: to buy a computer and very necessary methodological literature, which she needs very much in order to pass her courses and be more productive.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria de 50 años de edad, habita en el municipio de Soledad, donde se dedica a la venta de productos derivados de la harina de trigo, como deditos, empanadas etc. 
Desde hace 2 años data su experiencia, pues en ese  tiempo una amiga le  enseñó a preparar estos productos,  y su madre le impulsó esa idea de negocio,  pues a ella le gustó mucho. Sus principales productos, son las hayacas, deditos, empanadas y quibbes, los cuales ofrece de manera directa, sin intermediarios,  a crédito y de contado. 
De lunes a sábados, Maria se dedica a la preparación de su materia prima, mediante la mezcla, amasado,  moldeado y e cocción, agregando a cada uno de los productos, los insumos requeridos, como queso, carne, verduras etc. lo cual da como resultados deliciosos pasabocas de consumo inmediato y listos para la venta.  Su día laboral inicia a las 8 de la mañana y termina a las 6 de la tarde, y sus compras las realiza en las centrales de abastos del municipio.  Los principales clientes, están ubicados en el sector donde habita y tiene su negocio y su ideal propósito es lograr el reconocimiento de todos en su mercado objetivo.
En la actualidad todo el proceso lo hace manual y esto le exige cada vez mayor energía y genera mas cansancio. Ella en su empeño de crecer y responder al máximo a su clientela, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará una cilindradora, con la cual mejorará sus tiempos productivos, pues dejará de amasar manualmente, y aumentará su capacidad de producción, haciendo de su crédito una  inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and lives in the municipality of Soledad. She sells products made from  wheat flour such as deditos (a local pastry) and empanadas. She has two years experience doing this. A friend of hers showed her how to make these products. Her mother gave her the idea of doing it as a business as Maria enjoyed making them. 

Her main products are hayacas, qibbes, deditos and empanadas (all traditional meat filled pastries) which she offers directly to the public, not through middlemen, in cash and on credit. From Monday through Saturday she prepares the raw materials, measures them, kneads them, molds them and cooks them, adding the products and ingredients necessary for each one, such as cheese, meat and vegetables, etc.  The result is delicious snack ready to sell and eat. She starts her work day at 8 am and finishes at 6 pm. She buys the products from warehouses in the municipality. Her principal clients live in the area where she lives and has her business. Her goal is to be recognized by everyone in her marketing area. 

At present she does all the work manually and this requires more energy all the time. This makes her tired. In her effort to grow and respond to her client's demand Maria is requesting a loan from Kiva. It will be her first loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will use it to buy a dough rolling machine. This will reduce her production times as she won't have to knead by hand and also it will increase her production capacity. This makes it a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy a dough rolling machine.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is a first time borrower with Ugafode Microfinance Ltd (MDI), applying for a loan of 1,000,000 shillings. 

She is married with three children, and renting in Bukeesa, a trading centre outside Kampala city. near a neighboring university where she runs a average shop in her house. She gets an average income to provide for her family and relatives who live with her. The income provides for school fees and other necessities.

Harriet says the shop is doing well in terms of sales, however, she doesn't have adequate capital to increase her stock.  Thus, she is applying for a loan to boost the stock. 

In the future, she says she has plans to educate her children, pay off her loan well, and get subsequent loans to make a good credit history. She also wants to buy her own plot, develop it, and put up a commercial house (rental house) to avoid paying rent.

loans.use: To buy retail stock items

loans.name: Elviner

texts.en:
Elviner, who lives in the Malindi area of Kenya, is a married mother of two. Her major economic activity is firewood selling, a growing business she has been involved in for the last five years. The challenges she faces include transportation costs and taxation.

Elviner learned of Milanfo through friends and now seeks a loan to buy more firewood for resale. She hopes that in the next five years her business will have grown sufficiently to earn her an adequate income. An improved income will raise her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more firewood

loans.name: Aghunik

texts.en:
Aghunik is an experienced farmer from Mets Sepasar village, in the Shirak region. Her family consists of her husband, son, daughter-in-law, and one-year-old grandson. 

Aghunik's husband has migrated to Russia as a labor migrant to be able to work there and send money to the family in order for them to live on. Aghunik's son works for the village local self-governance body. His salary is so low that he cannot cover the basic daily needs of the family. 

Aghunik is engaged in cattle breeding, in the breeding of livestock of sheep, pigs, and hens, and in cultivation of wheat. Her son helps her sell the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is an important source of family's income. 

As the autumn is progressing, the family's agribusiness needs some investments in order for it to be productive. Aghunik needs a loan of USD 1,800 to purchase wheat seeds, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, to purchase forage for the livestock, and to pay for harvesting services. 

The family greatly relies on the goodwill of the lenders and they will be very grateful to them for their support in obtaining the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds, to buy fuel for agricultural machinery, to purchase forage for the livestock, and to pay for harvesting services.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram is 39 years old and lives in the village of Gugark, which is in the Lori region. Aram lives with his wife, three children, and retired parents. 

Aram’s elder son is a student of Yerevan State Polytechnic Institute, his second son studies at the school, and his small daughter goes to kindergarten. Arman has a big family and numerous problems; together with his wife, they just do their best to provide normal living conditions for all of them. 

Aram’s wife works as a secretary, and together with her husband, they also farm. They have a cute farm, and they breed two cows, calves, and piglets. Besides all this, Aram also has a butcher shop. He has only had this business for several months; the space is rented. In this shop, Aram sells his farm’s fresh meat - that is why he has many customers who trust him and buy meat specifically from his shop. 

Aram asks a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams to buy several bulls, which will provide meat for his butcher shop.  He will also buy some animal fodder.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder and several bulls, which will provide meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella lives in Kilifi, north of Mombasa, Kenya. She is 28 years old; a married businesslady with two children. 

She owns a tailoring busines that she has been running for the past five years. She started the business from income raised by her soft drink business and her personal savings. 

She learned of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy fabric for her business. She has ambitions of making her business a wholesale business in the next five years, despite the challenges of bad debts and competition. 

She will use the income from the loan to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 31-year-old married man from Gaza city. He lives with his wife in a very simple house in the city. 

For the past five years, Sami has been working in a paint store where he sells paints and other chemical materials for decoration. Sami would like to improve his store since the demand will increase this season. 
 
Sami requested a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products to sell in his paint store, to increase his sales and his income. 

Sami appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell in his paint store

loans.name: Cécile

texts.fr: Cécile est une femme de 50 ans qui a deux (02) enfants âgés 25 et 21 ans. La commerçante a ouvert et gère un mini restaurant scolaire depuis 8 ans dans lequel elle vend des repas africains et des boissons gazeuses. Ce crédit va lui permettre de renforcer son stock de matière premières pour ces repas (riz, macabo, viande, spaghetti, ndolé...) et son stock de marchandises (jus, eau minérale...) afin de répondre à la demande de ses clients et de ce fait d'augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice.  Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité, l'autre pour acheter une terrain et l'autre pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille (nutrition et éducation)
texts.en:
Cécile is a 50-year-old woman who has two children, aged 25 and 21. She opened and has been running a small school canteen for eight years, where she sells African meals and carbonated drinks. 

This loan will allow her to increase her stock of the basic ingredients (rice, macabo [a tuber similar to taro root], meat, spaghetti, ndolé [bitterleaf]...) for these meals and her stock of goods to sell (juice, mineral water, ...), so she can meet the needs of her customers and increase her sales and earnings.

She will reinvest part of her earnings back into her business. Part will be used to buy a piece of land, and the other part will be used to support her family's needs (diet and education).

loans.use: to by goods (juice, mineral water) to resell

loans.name: Abdirisaq Ibrahim

texts.en: Abdirisaq Ibrahim is 33 years old. He works at the university of Hargeisa. He needs a laptop for his work. He requested a laptop from Kaaba as a loan, and now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and he will pay monthly repayments. Abdirisaq hopes to improve his work performance as he gets the laptop and wants to work at home when there is extra work.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for work purposes

loans.name: Ismacil Ibrahim

texts.en: Ismacil Ibrahim is 19 years old.  He is a secondary school student.  He wants to start at the university after he finishes at his school, and he needs a laptop.  As a result, he requested that Kaaba give the laptop as a loan for him to pay installments.  Now he is waiting for the laptop.  Kaaba will provide the laptop to Ismacil as a loan, and he will pay monthly repayments. After the school Ismacil hopes to learn medicine and become a doctor.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Sulekha Omer

texts.en: Sulekha Omer is 29 years old with four children.  She finished nursing at Hargeisa School.  She works at Fatooh Hospital.  Her main challenge is the lack of a laptop.  She would like to use it for her daily work activities and for starting distance learning.  She approached Kaaba Microfinance Institution for a laptop.  Kaaba will provide the laptop to Sulekha as a loan, and she will pay monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for health work purposes.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 35 years old and married with five children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area. This includes information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

David grows maize, beans, and cassava on his loan. He also has goats, chickens and pigs. David has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, David will pay school fees for his children. His biggest dream in life is to become a commercial farmer so that he can raise his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and a weighing scale, so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mactar

texts.fr:
Monsieur Mactar, est commerçant depuis 10 ans maintenant. Il a ouvert un magasin dans le marché du quartier. Mactar est marié et père de famille. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 17h
Il est à son 1er crédit et sollicite un montant de 150.000FCFA pour  renouveler son stock  de accessoires (CD, DVD, cartes mémoire, clé USB) et divers autres  accessoires utilisées pour les téléphones. Il possède un bâtiment qu’il veut aussi réfectionner pour le mettre en location afin de diversifier ses sources de revenus et de pouvoir bien s’occuper  de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer.
Il a comme projet futur, d’ouvrir une autre cantine dans le même marché en comptant sur l’appui des préteurs.
texts.en:
Monsieur Mactar has been a merchant for 10 years now. He opened up a shop in the neighborhood market. Mactar is married and the father of a family. He begins his day at 8 am and quits at 5 pm. 

He is on his first loan and is requesting the amount of 150,000 f CFA to renew his stock of accessories (CDs, DVDs, memory cards, USB keys) and various other accessories used for telephones. He also owns a building that he would like to remodel in order to rent it out so as to diversify his sources of income and earn enough to cover the daily expenses of his household. 

His future plan is to open up another shop in the same market, counting on the support of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy memory cards for laptops, CDs and DVDs, etc.

loans.name: Serge Paulin

texts.fr: Serge est un jeune camerounais de 33 ans, célibataire, sans enfant.il gère une activité de vente de jus de fruits dans un quartier de la ville depuis 1 ans. il voudrait accroître ses ventes pour satisfaire sa clientèle en renforçant son stock de marchandises en achetant ses jus en gros. les bénéfices générés seront injectés dans son capital d'une part et subviendront aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part.
texts.en: Serge is a young 33-year-old Cameroonian. He is single and has no children. He has been running a business selling fruit juice in a district of town for 1 year. He would like to increase his sales and satisfy his customer demand by buying his fruit juice wholesale and increasing his inventory of merchandise. Part of the profits he makes will be used as working capital for his business, and part will be used to cover his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fruit juice for resale.

loans.name: Mukhtarkan

texts.ru: Мухтаркан 33 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Мухтаркан - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Мухтаркан занимается животноводством, стартовав 9 лет назад, с покупки скота на 8,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Мухтаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы. Ежемесячный доход Мухтаркан составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мухтаркан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с дальнейшим откормом и перепродажей. Доходы от кредита Мухтаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Mukhtarkan is 33 years old. She is married and she and her husband are raising 5 children. Mukhtarkan has high school education and, as the main source of income for her family, works rearing animals. She started this 9 years ago when she bought livestock for 8,000 Kyrgyz Som. Thanks to her hard work, Mukhtarkan currently has 4 dairy cows. Mukhtarkan's monthly income is 11,000 Kyrgyz Som. With the aim of further developing her farm, Mukhtarkan turned to the microfinance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 Som in order to buy bull-calves with the aim of feeding them up and selling them on. Mukhtarkan plans to use the profits from the loan to increase the quantity of her livestock and plans to save some money to refurbish her house.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Abdihakin Ahmed

texts.en: Abdihakin Ahmed is 21 years old. He finished at Admas University College, faculty of Information Technology. He needs a laptop to create IT programs and he cannot pay the money for the laptop all at one time. His good news was when he got the Kaaba-Kiva laptop loan. He approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. Abdihakin hopes to improve his IT skills as he has the laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for work purposes.

loans.name: Filsan Hussein

texts.en: Filsan Hussein is 29 years old. She has two children and she has finished at the University of Hargiesa, faculty of nursing. Now she started a Masters Degree of midwifery at the University of Hargeisa. She needs a laptop to use for her university lessons and she cannot pay the money all at one time. She requested that Kaaba give the laptop as a loan; then she will pay installments. Now she is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop to Filsan as a loan, and she will pay monthly repayments. After university, Filsan hopes to work as midwife.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for education purposes.

loans.name: Khadar Ali

texts.en: Khadar Ali is 29 years old, married and has two children. He is a student at the University of Hargeisa and also a teacher at Illays, a secondary school. He faces a major problem in both his learning and teaching because he needs a laptop to prepare lessons, use for university assignments and read lessons. He cannot buy one on his own, and has approached Kaaba MFI to secure funding to buy a laptop that he can pay for in installments. Khadar hopes to improve both his teaching and learning by getting the laptop.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Mohamed Jamac

texts.en: Mohamed Jamac is a 20-year-old single boy. He studies Information Technology at Alpha University College. His problem is that he has no laptop, and it’s difficult for him to do practical exercises. He has a Kaaba-Kiva Murabaha youth laptop loan product. He wanted a laptop loan and requested that they provide a laptop, on which he will pay installments. Now he is waiting for the laptop. Kaaba will provide the laptop as a loan, and Mohamed will pay monthly repayments. After university, Mohamed hopes to work as a database developer.

loans.use: To buy a laptop for educational purposes.

loans.name: Rosalie Soange

texts.fr: Rosalie Soange est une femme de 31 ans fiancée mère de 3 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 11 mois et 10 ans.  Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes, macabo et légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 5 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera acheter un camion des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Rosalie Soange is a 31 year old woman, who is engaged to be married and is the mother of three children, ranging in age from 11 months old to 10 years old. She is a saleswoman and has sold fresh produce (manioc, plantains, palm nuts, macabo and vegetables) at retail according to the season there at the market for 5 years. She has a good knowledge of her suppliers, and especially her clientele, which she has acquired over time thanks to her experience in this field. However, she constantly finds herself out of stock because she must first sell all of her stock in order to procure a new batch, due to the tininess of her supply of capital. She wishes to buy a truckload of plantains in order to have a good stock which will allow her to better meet the constant demand of her clientele and avoid running out of stock. She will save the profits not only to grow her business but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en: Anush is a young farmer from Saratak village in the Shirak region. Her family consists of her husband, three-year-old son, two-year-old daughter, and her parents-in-law. Anush's father-in-law is currently in Russia as a labor migrant. He works there and sends some money to the family. Anush's husband is a contractual serviceman in the military service. With the help of her family members, Anush is engaged in breeding cattle, sheep and pigs, in aviculture, and in the cultivation of wheat, potatoes, and alfalfa. The family realizes the agricultural products in the local market, which is an important source of their income. To run her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Anush needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase six calves, some forage (barley and grass) for the livestock, and wheat seeds. She and her big family will highly appreciate the lenders' good will and will be very thankful to them for their help in sustaining their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase six calves, forage (barley and grass) and wheat seeds

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina has two children, both of whom attend school, and they live in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. 

She has operated a medical clinic business for the past five years, selling medicine to her neighbours. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase medicines, syringes and tablets for her business. She joined Yehu to get loans that can boost her business to enable her to support her family well.

loans.use: to purchase medicines, syringes and tablets for her business.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: el señor Carlos habiat en el minucipio de Ticuantepe en la comarca llamada La Borgoña, desde muy joven se dedica a cultivar y trabajar la tierra, gracias a la enseñanza que sus padres le han heredado, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicacion se preocupa por el bienestar de su familia, actualmente tiene cinco manzanas de Piña cuñtivada y quiere aprovechar la lluvia de postrera para darle mantenimiento y asi evitar la quema y plagas, el credito lo solicita para comprar: urea, completo 20-60-20, triple, fertilizantes, etc. Agradece el apoyo que se ha brindado y la confianza en el puesta ya que gracias a las ganancias obtenidas su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe in the area called La Borgoña. He has farmed and worked the land from a very young age, thanks to the teachings that his parents passed down to him. 

With much effort and dedication, he concerns himself with the well-being of his family. Currently he has five manzanas (8.6 acres) of pineapple planted, and wants to take advantage of the late season rains to do maintainence on his crop, and this way avoid crop diseases and pests. He is requesting the loan to buy: urea, agricultural chemicals, fertilizers, etc. He is grateful for the support he has been offered and the trust placed in him, as thanks to the earnings obtained, his family has better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Mohamed Hassan

texts.en: Mohamed Hassan is 30 years old. He is a university student and also a secondary school teacher. He needs a laptop to prepare school lessons and he cannot pay the money all at one time. His good news was when he got the information of murabaha youth laptop loans. He approached Kaaba MFI and Kaaba will provide him with a laptop that he can pay for in installments. Mohamed hopes to improve his teaching as he has the laptop.

loans.use: To buy a laptop to prepare school lessons

loans.name: Joy's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of 10 women from one of Accra's suburbs. In the past, these women used to interact with one another through weekly savings groups' meetings, which allowed them to self-finance and support their income-generating activities. With the aim of strengthening the economic power of women, the group has recently entered into partnership with ID-Ghana, Kiva's partner, whose mission is to help them to better manage their activities in a professional way and earn more profits. Joy's group is therefore a credit group consisting of women who live in the same neighborhood and are involved in different trading activities including sales of provisions, detergent, flowers, noodles, maize, jeans, shirts, bags, etc.
 
The group's representative is named Joy. She is a married woman who has been selling charcoal and flowers for seven years. Joy works from as early as 6 AM until 6 PM every day. With the profits that she makes from her business, she is able to contribute to the daily expenses of the family and save part. Joy is a member of one of the local branches of ID-Ghana and she is requesting a loan to buy two bags of charcoal and flowers to resell to customers. Through this loan, she is hoping to see an increase in her profits. She would also like to contribute to the improvement of her family's food conditions. Her goal is to save some money and, in the future, to buy a car for a taxi business too.

They need a total amount of GHS 8,600 to be able to support their businesses.

loans.use: To buy two bags of charcoal and flowers, to resell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 37 years old and married with three children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land, David grows maize, beans, rice and cassava. He also has chickens and pigs. David has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, David will expand his poultry business. His biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer in his community and be able to provide for all his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en: Armenuhi is an experienced agronomist from Lusaghbyur village in the Lori region. She lives with her husband, daughter, and her elderly parents-in-law. She and her husband work in the military service. They are the only breadwinners of the family. Their salaries, however, are so low that they cannot afford a living based on those salaries. To be able to cover their daily needs, Armenuhi and her family are engaged in breeding cows, pigs, piglets, and hens, and in the cultivation of wheat, potatoes, apples and pears. They realize the agricultural products in the local market. To continue running her agribusiness and to sustain it, Armenuhi needs a loan of USD 2,500 to purchase barley seeds, to buy some fertilizers, to purchase some forage (grass and barley) for the livestock, and to make previous credit repayments. Armenuhi and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very grateful to them for their support.

loans.use: to purchase barley seeds, fertilizers, and forage and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane is a farmer from the village of Krashen in the Shirak region. She lives with her husband and son. To cover their needs Gayane and her family are engaged in cattle breeding, sheep breeding, aviculture, and in the cultivation of potatoes. Farming is the only source of income for the family. Gayane's husband and son sell the agricultural products in the local market. As the autumn is progressing, Gayane needs to make some investments in her agribusiness. 

A loan of 3,000 USD will be a huge support to this hard-working woman and her family, enabling her to purchase forage for the livestock and to buy alfalfa seeds. With the help of the loan, Gayane will prepare her agribusiness for winter. She and her family highly rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their support in collecting the needed loan to sustain their agribusiness.

loans.use: to purchase forage for the livestock and to buy alfalfa seeds

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
Andranik is 47 years old and lives with his family in Yerevan city. He is married and has three daughters. Andranik works as a security officer. His wife works at the college as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. Two of their daughters are already students and the smallest is still school-aged. 

Andranik’s elder daughter studies at the Yerevan State University at the faculty of Economy and Government in a paid division.  Andranik requests a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his elder daughter’s tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for his elder daughter’s tuition fee

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is hardworking and strives hard to earn a living and support her family well. Here again she comes to you requesting another loan of 50,000 KES to buy rice, baking powder, wheat flour, and maize flour for sale to her customers in her food stall. She appreciates the support given.

loans.use: to buy rice, baking powder, wheat flour, and maize flour for sale

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 47 years old and married with six children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Fred grows maize and cassava. He also has chickens and fish. Fred has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Fred will buy more fish for his farm. His biggest dream in life is to buy a water pump for his land so that he can irrigate his crops properly and earn enough money to provide for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a resident of Mombasa Kenya. He is a married businessman with two children. He runs a butcher shop in town that has been in operation for the last three years. 

The business has been growing over the years, and he seeks a loan to add more beef products to his business so that he can serve more people. He has ambitions of opening a butcher shop in a central business district in the near future so that he can serve more people. 

He knew of Milango through friends who asked him to join so that he can save and be able to access financing for his business. The challenges that he faces in the business include competition and inflation. He will use the income he will raise to educate his children.

loans.use: to add more beef products.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna, who is 50 years old, lives in Vanadzor city, which is in the Lori region. Ruzanna is married and she has a son and a daughter.  Ruzanna has a higher education degree in pedagogue and, for many years, she has worked at the school as a teacher of the English Language.  

There was a time when it was very hard to provide two students with normal living conditions and also pay tuition fees with the salary of teacher.  So, she decided to start her own clothing trading business.  She mainly sells women’s clothing at a rented stall in the city’s wholesale market.  Ruzanna brings products to her stall from the Yerevan wholesale markets once a month with the help of her husband. 

Ruzanna requests a loan of 1,000,000 AMD so that she can both renew her stall’s women’s clothing assortment and buy women’s under garments to begin selling as well.

loans.use: to renew her stall’s women's clothing assortment and to buy women's under garments to begin selling as well.

loans.name: Sauti

texts.en:
Sauti is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cashew nuts business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. In addition, she also sells dumplings. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a coffeehouse in the near future. 

With the 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES), she wants to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi sells fruits and green vegetables. She always struggles to improve her grocery stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. Here again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale. She appreciates the previous loan that helped her to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fruits and green vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria, es una joven estudiante de medicina, ella solicita un préstamo para poder pagar todos sus gastos educativos y poder terminar su carrera, esta es su historia: Hola mi nombre es Victoria, tengo 23 años de edad, vivo en Jima Arriba (La Vega), tengo 6 hermanos y 4 hermanas, no soy casada ni tengo hijos, mi padre es agricultor y mi madre fallecida. 
Estudio la carrera de Medicina en la Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI), he tomado varias materias de la carrera como son: anatomía, fisiología, histología, epidemiologia,  investigación en ciencias médica, gerencia en salud, entre otras y mis favoritas son anatomía y fisiología. 
Solicito este préstamo porque no tengo los recursos económicos suficientes para pagar la carrera, si no lo recibo quizás debería dejar de estudiar, pero si lo recibo podría terminar con éxito mi carrera y convertirme en una gran profesional. 
Mis metas al estudiar medicina son, primeramente pasar todas las materias con las mejores calificaciones para tener un buen récord académico, también ayudar a toda mi familia ya que ellos me han apoyado y quiero lograr esta meta para tener una vida mejor económicamente y esto me satisface porque será ayudando a las personas a mantener y obtener su salud. Cuando termine quiero hacer una especialidad mientras trabaje en el sector salud.
texts.en:
Victoria is a young medical student and she is asking for a loan to cover her education expenses and to be able to finish her degree. This is her story: 
Hello, my name is Victoria, I am 23 years old, I live in Jima Arriba, I have 6 brothers and 4 brothers. I am not married and I do not have any children. My father is a farmer and my mother is deceased. 
I study medicine at the Universidad Católica Tecnológica del Cibao (UCATECI),I have taken many courses in my degree like anatomy, physiology, organic chemistry, epidemiology, research in medicinal sciences, health management and others, but my favorites are anatomy and physiology. 
I am applying for this loan because I don't have the economic resources available to pay for my schooling. If I don't get funding, I may not be able to finish my degree, but if I do get funding I will be successful in finishing school and I will be a great professional. 
My goals in studying medicine are, first, to pass all of my exams with the best grades possible so I can have a good academic record and I also want to be able to help my family because they are all supporting me and I want to achieve my dreams in order to have a more financially secure future and this would  also make be happy because I would be able to help people get and stay healthy. When I am done, I want to study a specialty while I work in the health sector.

loans.use: pay for tuition, books, transportation and more for her studies in medicine.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George lives in the Kongowea area in Kenya. He is 38 years old and he is also married with three children. He runs a small retail shop in Kongowea that has been in operation for the last two years. He plans to curb the challenge of transport in his business by buying a motorbike. He knew of Milango through  friends who invited him to join so that he could make savings and be able to access credit to fund the business. He has ambitions of running a big shop that will deal with consumption goods. The challenges that he faces in the business are competition, price changes, and inflation. The income that he will raise from the business will improve his standards of living.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Morrice

texts.en:
Morrice is 26 years old and is single without any children yet. He earns his income through the sale of crops, and he receives monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. Morrice also has a small business. 

On his land Morrice grows maize, beans, sunflowers, peanuts and cassava. He also has cows, goats, chickens and pigs. Morrice has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Morrice will invest in his farm. His biggest dream in life is to provide a good education for children.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is 38 years old and married with eight children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land, Apollo grows maize, beans, rice, sunflowers, peanuts, bananas and cassava. He also has chickens and pigs. Apollo has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Apollo will invest in his farm by buying animals for ploughing, and planting trees on his land. His biggest dream in life is to provide a good education to his children and be able to meet all his family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Darejan

texts.en:
Darejan is 47 years old, widowed, and from the town of Gori, where she lives with her son. Darejan works as an operator at the local bus station and gets a monthly salary.  She owns a car and rents it to earn additional income.  She is a very enthusiastic woman and a good mother who wishes to provide her only child with better living conditions.

Darejan is applying for a loan to purchase an additional secondhand car and rent it out as well. She will get more income and improve their standard of living in the future. Darejan hopes for your generosity.

loans.use: to purchase a car and rent it out

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is married and has five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a cashew-nuts selling business, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Mwanatumu is requesting a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew-nuts for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew-nuts.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with six children who attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates an open air food business, selling dumplings to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a cafe business in the near future. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Adhengi

texts.en:
Adhengi lives in Mombasa, Kenya.  He is 33 years old and he is married with four children.  He is a businessman and he runs a transport business in town that has been in existence for the last year.  He has been able to grow the business to the point where he has employed someone to help him run it.  The main challenge he faces in this business is that maintenance costs are high at times.

He learned about Milango through friends and now he is seeking a loan to buy another motorbike for his business.  He hopes that his business will continue to grow so that he will be able to diversify into another business in the future.  He will use the anticipated increase in income to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy another motorbike.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 51 years old and he lives in the village Ddmashen, which is in the Gegharkunik region. Murad is married and he has a daughter, who is married and lives with her family, and a son, who works at the TV company, as an operator. 

Murad and his wife earn their living by being engaged in farming and agriculture. They breed on their farm a cow, a heifer, three piglets, 10 sheep, and 20 chickens. On their plot of land, they cultivate potatoes and cabbages. Murad sells all his farm products at the local wholesale market. 

Murad asks for a loan of AMD 800,000 (Armenian drams) in order to buy a hay-mowing machine, which he will use on his own and which he can rent to his villagers.

loans.use: to buy a hay-mowing machine, which he will use on his own and which he can rent to his villagers.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam lives in the Changamwe area near Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a garage in town that has been in operation for the last seven years. The business has grown since it was started, and he has managed to hire three trainees at the garage who help him in dealing with the work there. Competition and price changes are his main challenges in the business.

Adam learned of Milango through a fellow businessman and decided to join. He is now applying for a 41,900 KES loan to buy spare parts for the garage. He will use his profits to raise and educate his children. He hopes that in the future he will own a car hire business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his garage

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en: Nicholas is 26 years old and is married with one child. He earns his income through the sale of crops and he receives a monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. Nicholas also has a small business. On his land, Nicholas grows maize, beans, pineapples, bananas, and cassava. He also has chickens and pigs. Nicholas has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years.
