As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Nicholas will make improvements to his home. His biggest dream in life is to free people in his community from poverty by helping them to adopt good agricultural practices.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Diana's Group

texts.en:
Diana's group consists of all women who are married. These women are, on average, 35 years old and have children. They all live in extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Teshie, in the greater Accra region. The members of the group know one another through family, neighborhood and friendship ties.

The women in this group sell plantains, spices, secondhand clothing, sanitary pads, various provisions, sachet water and jeans. They are on their fifth group loan with ID Ghana. They are applying for a 4,950 GHS loan so they will be able to expand their businesses.

Diana herself is a 39-year-old plantain and spices seller. She is planning to buy more plantains and spices from the market in Accra. She will resell her merchandise at retail to both men and women. She is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 100 GHS, which will be used to meet the needs of her family. A part of her profits will also be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy more plantains and spices

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en: Josephine lives in the Changamwe area in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 39 years old and married with three children. She sells clothes and ropes in the local market and she has been in the business for the last six years. Her business has really grown from the time she started and she has been able to employ two people who help her in running the business. She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy more ropes and clothes for her business. The major challenges that she has been facing in the business is competition and inflation. The income that she will raise will improve her standards of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more ropes and clothes

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a thirty-four-year-old man. He is married to Bridgit and is the father of two children. He operates a taxi business in Kangemi and has been in this business for one and half years. He gets a monthly income of forty thousand shillings.

This will be Robert's first loan with KADET LTD. He plans to use the entire loan to buy spare parts for the taxi and also take the car for service. In the future he wants to start a car hire business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the taxi

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is a young private entrepreneur from Yerevan.  She lives with her husband. Both of them work hard to be able to earn a living. 

Ruzanna has a small business.  She purchases different decorative toys from Dubai and resells them to one of the big supermarket networks of the city.  It has already been more than three years since Ruzanna started to run her business and she has become experienced and successful in it. 

She currently needs a loan of 3,000 USD in order to purchase new items from Dubai to resell.  The loan will help her sustain her small business.  Ruzanna and her husband rely on the good will of the lenders and will be thankful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount for the loan.

loans.use: to purchase new items from Dubai.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
Aziz is 26 years old and married with five children. He owns a farm upon which he grows maize, beans, rice, bananas, peanuts, peas, mangoes and cassava. He also has chickens and goats. He makes a living through the sale of crops and livestock.

Aziz also receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). These are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools.

Aziz has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smart phone, solar charging set and scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Aziz will buy some oxen to help plow his land. His biggest dreams in life are to add more land to his farm and to buy some property and a nice car.

loans.use: buy some oxen to help plow his land

loans.name: Constantine

texts.en: Constantine is 52 years old and married with 9 children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. Constantine also has a transportation business. On his land Constantine grows maize, beans, coffee, peanuts, bananas, and cassava. He also has chickens, goats and pigs. Constantine has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Constantine will buy a tractor to plough his land. His biggest dream in life is to improve the lives of the farmers in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel is 32 years old and has one child. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. On his land Emmanuel grows maize, beans, peas, peanuts, bananas, eggplants, and cassava. He also has chickens and pigs. Emmanuel has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Emmanuel will invest the money into his farm to grow his income. His biggest dream in life is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 33 years old and is married with four children. All her children attend school. She runs a business in town, selling clothes. She deals mostly with second-hand clothes and she has been in this business for the last five years. The business has been growing and she has been able to employ someone to help her run the business. She knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy five bales of second-hand clothes. She has a vision of importing up to twenty bales of clothes in the next five years. The challenge in the business is the competition from other traders. The income that she will raise improve her standards of living.

loans.use: to buy five bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Eunice's Group

texts.en:
Eunice's group consists of trading women. These women are, on average, 30 years old and have children. They all live in extended traditional families in the neighborhood of Teshie, in the greater Accra region. The members of the group know one another through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. 

They sell smoked fish, charcoal, sandals, corned beef, wigs, underwear, and vegetables. They are on their seventh group loan with ID-Ghana. 

Eunice is 32 years old, and she sells smoked fish. She is planning to buy two cartons of smoked fish to sell to customers in Accra. She will resell her merchandise to a retail customer base consisting of both men and women. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of GHS 130, which will be used to meet the needs of her family. A part of her profits will also be reinvested in her business. 

The group needs a total of GHS 4,900 to be able to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To buy two cartons of smoked fish to sell to customers in Accra.

loans.name: Patila

texts.ru: Патиле 64 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает 6 детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Патили - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Патила занимается животноводством, стартовав 20 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Патили, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Патила обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Патила планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Patila is 64 years old and a widow. After the death of her husband she raises six children by herself, and also manages her own business. Patila has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Patila works with livestock breeding, after having started 20 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Patila's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow and ten sheep. The monthly income is 5,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Patila turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of sheep to increase the number of livestock. Patila plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a small-scale grocer in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education, as she completed elementary school. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Abena has been working as a grocer for close to eleven years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of groceries, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to expand into larger markets.

loans.use: to buy more groceries, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a Ghanaian artisan who carves authentic African masks by hand and is training other artisans. He would like to buy raw materials for his workshop to continue production. Wilson has been selling his art through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I became interested in Ghanaian African carvings when I was a child, so after middle school I learned the trade through a man named Mr. Akoffour. Now I have my own workshop and am training three people. I carve different types of masks and each of them has a meaning. My products are unique and my target is to create more." 

"I thank all of you for being there for me. Without your help, I wouldn't be where I am today. My family and I are very grateful to all of you."

Use the link below to view Wilson's African masks on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/4507.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his workshop to continue production

loans.name: Arkadya

texts.en:
Arkadya is 42 years old, and he lives with his family in Ijevan city in Tavush region. Arkadya is married, and he has a one-year-old very nice daughter. His wife has a specialty of teaching, but now she does not work; she takes care of their daughter. 

Arkadya for many years till now has worked as a contractual serviceman, and only through his salary the family covers its expenses. Their flat where they live needs to be completely repaired, but since they don't have the money, Arkadya has decided just to separate a small room for his daughter and make a nice and cute bedroom for her.

Arkadya asks a loan of AMD 1,100,000 to make a nice bedroom for his lovely daughter and also to buy some furniture for that room.

loans.use: to make a nice bedroom for his daughter and buy furniture for that room

loans.name: Topchugul

texts.ru: Топчугул 49 лет, не замужем, одна воспитывает 3 приемных детей. У Топчугул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Топчугул занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Топчугул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, а также имеет земельный надел размером 1,0 ГА, на которой она ежегодно выращивает: кукурузу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Топчугул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телок для откорма и разведения. Доходы от кредита Топчугул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на женитьбу приемного сына.
texts.en:
Topchugul is 49 years old, not married, and raising three foster children by herself. Topchugul has secondary education. As a main source of income for her family, Topchugul works with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation, after having started 23 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Topchugul's persistent work, her farm currently has one dairy cow and also a plot of land of 1.0 hectares. Here she grows sweet corn every year. The monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Topchugul turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of heifers to fatten and breed. Topchugul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money for the marriage of her foster son.

loans.use: to buy heifers for fattening and breeding

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Розы - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Роза занимается животноводством, стартовав 11 лет назад, с покупки скота на 50,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Розы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 5 дойных коров, 2 теленка, 5 овец, 3 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Роза обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одной коровы и одной лошади для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Roza is 30 years old, married and raising four children together with her husband. Roza has secondary education. As a main income for her family, Roza works with livestock breeding, after having started 11 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Roza's persistent work, her farm currently has five dairy cows, two calves, five sheep and three goats. The monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her business, Roza turned to the microfinance bank "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a cow and a horse to increase the number of livestock. Roza plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of household animals. She also plans to save money for building a new house.

loans.use: to buy a cow and a horse

loans.name: Kojo

texts.en:
Kojo is single and sells beers and spirits in Sefwi near Cape Coast, which he has been doing for two years. The proceeds from his business go towards helping him support himself and his extended family. 

Kojo is requesting a loan, which he will use to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of beer and spirits. In the long term, Kojo plans to reinvest his future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine lives in Mombasa, Kenya. She is forty years old and married with two children. She has sold clothes for the past year, and the business has seen tremendous growth. She has been able to employ someone to help her run the business. Competition from other traders is her main challenge.

Catherine knew of Milango through friends who encouraged her to join so that she could access credit to fund her business. She is asking for a 21,100 KES loan to buy ten bales of clothes to sell.

The profits Catherine realizes will enable her to improve her family’s living standards. She has ambitions that her venture will grow into a wholesale business within the next five years.

loans.use: to buy ten bales of clothes

loans.name: Milton

texts.en:
Milton, a 48-year-old married father of five, earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock, and he also receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On his land Milton grows beans, coffee, potatoes, peanuts, bananas, pineapples and cassava. He also has chickens and goats. Milton has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. 

With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Milton will develop some property and buy a dairy cow for his farm. His biggest dream in life is to have a sustainable source of income and be able to provide for all the needs of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Nigora

texts.ru:
Нигора молодая, очень трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 28 лет. Она успешный предприниматель и имеет 10 летний опыт в области торговли, но за этот  промежуток времени она достигла намного  хорошего результата.Она продает продукты питания.
 Нигора замужем, имеет одного ребенка, живет со своей семей в Дж. Расуловском районе. Её торговая точка находится на центральном рынке в многолюдном месте. Муж работает в частных стройках а в свободное время помогает жене. В этом году летом Нигора осуществляла маленькую  стройку летней кухни, и на  эту стройку потратила деньги  которые были взяты с оборота.  Её товарооборот уменьшился, и поэтому Нигора обратилась в "Арванд" за финансовой поддержкой. На полученный кредит она хочет закупить продукты питания и увеличить свой товарооборот.  Нигора заранее благодарит Арванд за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Nigora is a young and very hard-working woman, 28 years of age. She is a successful entrepreneur. 
She has 10 year of experience in retail and has been able to improve her outcomes during this time. She sells groceries. Nigora is married and has one child. She lives with her family in the J. Rasulov region. Her sales point is at the central market, in a busy location. Her husband works at private construction sites, and in his free time helps his wife. This summer Nigora has completed some minor remodeling of her summer kitchen; in order to do  this, she had to spend money taken out of her working capital. Her sales volume decreased, which is why she turned to Arvand for financial support. She would like to use her credit to stock up on groceries and increase her sales volume. Nigora thanks Arvand in advance for its help and support.

loans.use: to buy food.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is married and has five children. Even though she grew up in poverty, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she  prepares and sells gari, a traditional Ghanaian snack made from starched powdered cassava, in Sefwi near Cape Coast, which she has been doing for 10 years. Ama uses the income from her business to help her family. 

Ama has noticed that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her gari but she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited inventory capacity. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty gari. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama wants to ensure that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase cassava

loans.name: Jerome

texts.en:
Jerome is a young Cameroonian who is thirty years old. He is single and has no children.

For the past two years Jerome has become experienced in selling fish, and his business is profitable. He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban center with many potential customers.

Jerome is applying for a 300,000 XAF loan for his fish business, which he estimates will help him increase his profits by 17 percent. He knows this would go a long way toward improving his living standard.

loans.use: to buy fish in large quantities to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He also receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. 

On his land, David grows maize, beans, peanuts, bananas, sweet potatoes, and cassava. He also raises chickens and pigs. David has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, he will invest in his farm by building a pig sty and chicken house for his livestock. His biggest dream is to work his way out of poverty so that he can help others to do the same.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Maame is divorced and has two children. After successfully graduating middle school, Maame is now an established businesswoman. She sells doughnuts in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about two years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Maame uses her income to provide for the entire family. Maame will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of doughnut ingredients, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of doughnut ingredients which will help her improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is single and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Esi is a successful businesswoman. She sells smoked fish in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family. Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish which will help improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cassava, maize, and rice in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. Ama is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. 

Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels which will allow allowing her to sell greater quantities of cassava, maize, and rice. In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels which will allow her to sell greater quantities of cassava, maize, and rice.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling smoked fish in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for two years. Maame is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Maame will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish which will help her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Maame plans to further diversify the type of products she sells.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of smoked fish which will help her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Kofi

texts.en:
Although he has received no formal education, Kofi is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling second-hand clothing near Cape Coast. He has been involved in this enterprise for two years. 

Kofi is married and has four children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Kofi wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of second-hand clothing. In the long term, Kofi plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase his current inventory levels of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Abena is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She usually sells her ‘Gari’ in Sefwi  (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Gari’ for ten years. 

Abena is married and has five children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Abena wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Gari’. In the long term, Abena plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of cassava, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 38 years old and married with four children. She farms maize, beans, rice, cassava, peanuts, bananas and potatoes. She also has chickens, pigs and goats.

Mary also earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). These are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area, including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools.

As a CKW Mary uses the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smart phone, a solar charging set, and a scale) to perform her CKW duties and so help her neighbors to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. She has served as a CKW for the last two years, and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years.

With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Mary will invest in her farm by buying more pigs and starting to grow fruit to sell. Her biggest dream in life is to have well-educated children and a nice house for her family.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and start growing fruit

loans.name: Moliwe

texts.en:
A 30-year-old married business lady, Moliwe lives in Mombasa Kenya where she runs a boutique that has been in operation for two years now. The business has experienced growth since it began, and Moliwe has managed to employ two other ladies to help her run it.  The challenges she faces are competition and price fluctuations.

Moliwe learned of Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to buy hair oil to sell in her boutique.  She will use her income to pay school fees for her children and also improve the enterprise.  Moliwe hopes that her business will grow to the point that she can employ more people in the future.

loans.use: to buy hair oil

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
When Jorge moved to the US from Venezuela four years ago, he immediately set his entrepreneurial skills to work. He created his own business selling ice cream and hot dogs as a street vendor, and has been steadily growing his profits over the years. A five-time repeat borrower in good standing with the Intersect Fund, Jorge has seen the benefits of micro-loans on his business.

With this loan, Jorge will purchase a new vending cart, so that he can expand his venture.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending cart for thriving hot dog business

loans.name: Acema

texts.en:
Acema is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock. He also earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases, and agricultural tools. 

On his land, Acema grows cassava, bananas, cabbages, and vegetables. He also raises chickens. Acema has served as a CKW for the last two years and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Acema will buy some goats for his farm. His biggest dream is to be a model farmer in his community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that he may provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Yesu Yakola Group

texts.en:
This group is located in Kyotera town, Rakai district. Members in the group do different activities.

Janat is a single mother of four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 7 years, of whom only two go school. She is a 'matooke' (green banana) seller, a business which she started in 2012.

She does this activity along a busy road and her clients come from Kyotera town and those traveling out of the town. She started the business so as to boost her income base. The challenge with her business is transport especially during the rainy season where the roads are slippery and impassable.
Janat wants to buy herself a plot of land and build a residential house.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 26 years old and does not yet have any children. She earns her income through the sale of crops, livestock and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. 

On her land Teddy grows maize, beans and peanuts. She also has chickens. Teddy has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Teddy will invest in her farm to help grow her income. Her biggest dream in life is to be a model farmer in her community.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Nafissatou's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de 4 femme est créé depuis la création de son Banc Villageois le 22 mars 2001. du fait de la bonne progression des membres en épargne et en crédit. Madame Nafissatou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est la représentante du groupe. Elle est âge de 43 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de trois enfants dont un garçon. Elle est très expérimentée dans ce domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiqué depuis plusieurs années. Le prêt sollicité servira à acheter 25 pièces de tissus teintés qu'elle va revendre à domicile par un système de vente à crédit. Les bénéfices générés par l'activité serviront à la prise en charge des frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
This group of 4 women was established at the same time as their Banc Villageois, on March 22, 2001, because the members have made excellent progress in terms of savings and loans. 

The group's representative is Nafissatou, who is raising her hand on the right in the photo. She is 43 years old, widowed, and the mother of three children, including one son. 

Nafissatou benefits from several years of experience in this domain. The requested loan will allow her to buy 25 lengths of dyed fabric that she will re-sell on credit from her home. The income generated by this business will be used to pay for her children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy dyed fabric.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Araba did not have access to formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Araba sells doughnuts in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about two years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have three children. 

Araba uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Araba will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of doughnut ingredients, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Araba wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of doughnut ingredients

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Nana is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling rice and fish in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years. 

Nana is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Nana will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of rice and fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of rice and fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Daavi

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Daavi is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She can be found selling ‘Gari’ in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

Daavi is married and has seven children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her ‘Gari’ business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Daavi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Daavi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame is a small scale cassava seller in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a junior-high-school graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. 

Maame has sold cassava for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of cassava, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a cassava stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of cassava, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
After graduating junior high school, Nana decided to set up her own ‘Gari’ selling business. Gari is a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava. She prepares her ‘Gari’ on her own and proceeds to sell it in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). With over four years worth of experience, Nana is currently looking to expand her enterprise further. Unfortunately, she is limited due to a lack of funding. 

As a result, this loan will be used to help her purchase more cassava, thus enabling her to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Gari’. She aims at using the profits from her business to help her husband (who is a farmer) with the upkeep of their house whilst ensuring that their two children are able to experience a better life.

loans.use: purchase more cassava to prepare and sell more of her tasty ‘Gari’.

loans.name: Frank Eric

texts.en: Frank is a Cameroonian aged 38 who is not married and does not have a child. He has been in this business for over two years which makes him experienced and stable. He is likely to succeed because his business is located in an urban area which gives him many potential customers. This loan will help him increase his profits by 50 % and his standard of living will increase as well.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Although she has received no formal education, Aba is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough wrapped in banana leaves). She usually sells her ‘kenkey’ in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘kenkey’ for twenty years. 

Aba is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Aba wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of maize, thus increasing her current inventory levels. This will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘kenkey’. In the long term, Aba plans to reinvest future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of maize

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Amina is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling maize in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for nine years. 

Amina is married and has four children. Her husband works as a driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees. 

Amina wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of maize. 

In the long term, Amina plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand her business and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of maize.

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Nana is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling provisions in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). He has been involved in this enterprise for ten years. 

Nana is married and has five children. His wife works with him at the store. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Nana will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, Nana plans to further diversify the type of products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of provisions, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is divorced and has two children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Esi is a successful businesswoman. She sells fabric in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Esi uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Esi will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fabric, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of fabric, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa is single and has two children. Despite her lack of formal education, Adjoa is an established businesswoman. She sells cassava in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about fifteen years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Adjoa uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of the cassava she sells, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is single and has four children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ekua is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘gari’ for a living (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She normally sells her ‘gari’ in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about five years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ekua uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava to make 'gari' (processed cassava)

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.ru: Этого начинающего бизнесмена зовут Холмат. Ему 34 года. Он женат и проживает с женой и детьми в районе Шахритус. Его жена дома занимается шитьем. Сам Холмат работает мастером по ремонту домов. С наступлением холодов Холмат остается без заказов и естественно без источника дохода. Поэтому он хочет параллельно начать новый бизнес по купле и продаже крупнорогатого скота. У него при дворе дома имеется коровник, а также запас 200 вязок высушенной кукурузной травы. Он запрашивает кредит, чтобы закупить двух молодых бычков хорошей породы. Холмат планирует откармливать бычков в течение 30-35 дней и выводить на продажу на местный рынок. Благодаря данному кредиту Холмат будет обеспечен прибыльным бизнесом.
texts.en:
This aspiring businessman's name is Kholmat.  He is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan.  His wife busies herself with sewing at home, while Kholmat works as a home repair contractor.  As winter draws near, Kholmat has been getting fewer and fewer clients, and has been earning less as a result, which is why he's decided he'd like to start up his own cattle-selling business.  He already has a cow barn at his house, and also has 200 bundles of hay on hand made from corn stalks.  

He is seeking a loan to buy a couple of young bulls for his business.  He plans on fattening the bulls for around 30-35 days, then selling them at a local market.  With the help of this loan, Kholmat will have the makings of a profitable business.

loans.use: buy 2 young bulls of good pedigree.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling groceries in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. 

Efua is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees.

 Efua wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries. In the long term, Efua plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of groceries.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua is a widow and she has one child. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Efua is a successful businesswoman. She prepares and sells ‘kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian staple dish that is made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves) for a living. She normally sells her kenkey in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 20 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is widowed with five children. Imelda is 49 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela, Philippines.

Imelda is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.

Imelda has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Imelda hopes to save for some emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies.

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en: Annelyn is a single entrepreneur who has run her business for more than a year. She sells cosmetic products and homemade sausage in her community in addition to farming. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy more cosmetic products and homemade sausage to resell. This photo was taken outside her parents' house beside their farm. She is hopeful of generating additional revenue and saving money to build her own house in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products and homemade sausage to resell

loans.name: Los Mangos Group

texts.es: “Los mangos” es un grupo ubicado en la comunidad de Santa Rosa de Lima una comunidad con muchos árboles sus habitantes son personas muy alegres, trabajadoras pero sobretodo emprendedoras casi nunca tienen tiempo para otras actividades porque siempre están ocupados en sus negocios. Porque ellos no querían tener un nombre común y como el nombre de flores o plantas son muy repetitivas decidieron buscar  un nombre de frutas y se les ocurrió mangos. Doña Amanda tiene 52 años de edad está casada con el señor Rubén desde hace 30 años juntos han formado una familia con cuatro hijos  que ya no dependen de dicha pareja, Doña Amanda se dedica a la cría y engorda de cerdos para su venta desde hace ya 15 años tiene una muy buena estructura para tener muchos cerdos hasta el momento tiene 40 cerdos muy bien nutridos. Esta vez está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund y KIVA para comprar alimento para sus cerdos que tiene en su casa, Doña Amanda nunca compra cerdos de otras personas, sus mismas cerdas nacen cerditos chicos y son los que se encarga de crecer y engordar para después vender con un comprador fijo quien se dedica  hacer carnitas todos los días también con otro cliente en el municipio su venta es segura. Doña Amanda comento “No tengo ninguna dificultad porque desde pequeña tuve la experiencia de criar estos animales, es una actividad heredada por mis padres”.  El sueño de Doña Amanda es poder llegar a tener mas saudas para tener más cerdos siempre le ha gustado tener animales y no quisiera dejar de criar porque de alguna manera con sus ganancias ayuda a su esposo  con los gastos del hogar. Así como Doña Amanda esta agradecida con su crédito también el resto del grupo para invertir en sus negocios Lucia, Placida invertirá en tortillas, Nayeli y Brigida invertirán en el alimento para sus cerdos, José Juan invertirá en pollos, Martha en flores.
texts.en:
Los Mangos is a group that is located in the Santa Rosa de Lima community.  It is a community with a lot of trees.  Its inhabitants are very happy people who are hard-working, and, above all, they are entrepreneurs who almost never have time for other activities.  This is because they are always busy with their businesses.  

They did not want to have a common name, and because flower or plant names are very repetitive, they decided to look for a fruit name, and mangos occurred to them.

Amanda, age 52, has been married to Rubén for 30 years.  Together they have formed a family with four children, who are no longer dependent upon the couple.  Amanda has been raising and fattening pigs to sell for 15 years.  She has a very good structure for having a lot of pigs.  To date she has 40 very well-fed pigs.

This time she is requesting a loan from VisionFund and Kiva to buy feed for her pigs that she has at her house.  Amanda never buys pigs from other people.  Her own pigs give birth to little pigs, and those are the ones she raises and fattens to later sell to a fixed buyer.  The buyer makes carnitas every day.  She also sells to another customer in the municipality, and her sale is assured.

Amanda states, “I don’t have any difficulty because I have had the experience of raising these animals ever since I was little.  It is a business activity that I inherited from my parents”.  Amanda’s dream is to be able to have a more money in order to have more pigs.  She has always liked having animals, and she would not like not raising them.  This is because, with her income, she helps her husband with the household expenses.

Amanda is grateful for her loan.  The rest of the group is also grateful to invest in their businesses.  Lucia and Placida will buy tortillas, Nayeli and Brigida will buy feed for their pigs, José Juan will buy chickens, and Martha will buy flowers.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

location.town: SanTa Rosa de Lima El oro

loans.name: Nohn

texts.en:
Nohn is 47 years old, and she has been living in Sanniquellie, the capital city of Nimba County which is rich in natural resources. Living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia, and it is the second most populated county in Liberia. 

Nohn did not go to school. She has five children between 11 and 30 years old; only two are in school and live at home. With a  little money from her mother, she was able to establish her business in 2009. She has been running a small local shop where she sells onions, oil, salt, etc in the local market. She spends 9 hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. A problem she faces is inadequate income; she is requesting a loan to purchase more onions, oil, salt, etc. for her business. Her plan is to one day to build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more onions, oil, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Yemma

texts.en:
Yemma is 35 years old, married with one kid who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Yemma has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Yemma requested a PHP 9,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Yemma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Yemma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 58 years old, married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Teresita has a food production business in the Philippines. Teresita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

Teresita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Teresita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy utensils and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 38 years old and married with three children.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional charcoal to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid back ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling charcoal for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried coconut.

Rosalinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 52 years old, married, and has five children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, which she has been doing for three years.  She earns additional income from raising pigs.

Betty is requesting a loan from NWTF for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Adjoa is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells “gari” (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She can be found selling gari in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. 

Adjoa is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her gari business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Adjoa will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adjoa plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of cassava, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua operates a yam-selling business in Sefwi (near Cape Coast). Efua is a single mother with one child. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Efua uses her income to provide for the entire family. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of yams, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a junior-high-school graduate, Efua understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her child remains in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of yams, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is widow who has three adult children who help her in her farm. Aside from making money from their coconut farm, she also has a vegetable plot from which she earns a little amount weekly as an aid to their monthly income. 

She borrowed a loan from GDMPC micro-credit to buy new variety of vegetable seeds and fertilizer. She is determined to have more income and hopes to have another plot with a new variety of vegetables. She hopes that in the near future, she will earn well enough to improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy a new variety of vegetable seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is 37 years old and married, with four children.

Rhea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Rhea has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her general store for four years, and she also earns an income from food vending.

Rhea aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
As the married parent of seven children, Lucy works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns income from fattening pigs. 

Lucy is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy more ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc., for her food-vending business.

Lucy has sustained her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients like bananas, cooking oil, sugar, etc

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 44 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Mary Grace is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary Grace has been farming rice for eight years and earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Enriliza

texts.en:
Enriliza is 39 years old and married with one child.

Enriliza works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as canned goods, milk, sugar, soap, shampoo, etc.

Enriliza has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Enriliza aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ushindi Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bulambo est une présidente du groupement de crédit « Ushindi », jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 35 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui étudient tous. Son conjoint un enseignant. La cliente est  une vendeuse des souliers.  Elle installe ses articles  au marché public. Elle commença ses affaires avec  l’assistance de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 15  ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 2 ballons des souliers.  Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants, étendre son projet de commerce et construire une jolie maison. Les vols, les impayés, les pertes de change sont de défis pour le développement de son activité. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout ; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Bulambo is the president of the “Ushindi” borrowing group. She is an experienced and dynamic young entrepreneur, who is 35 years old and has 6 children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a teacher. 

Bulambo has been selling shoes for 15 years, displaying her merchandize in the public market. She began her business with help from her husband. Later, she received a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima. She will use this new loan to buy 2 bales of shoes. She hopes this will allow her to send her children to school, to expand her business and to build a lovely house. 

The expansion of her business is hindered by theft, unpaid debts and losses. In closing, she is extremely grateful to Hekima for enabling the empowerment of women who don’t have access to traditional banking, especially during this critical time of conflict in the Eastern part of the country.

loans.use: acheter 2 ballons des souliers.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Manu

texts.en:
It seems only natural for Manu to manage his own information technology company. With several years of experience in consulting, managing, designing and developing business and system applications, Manu knows the industry in and out. He has worked in various industries, from banking and finance to manufacturing, and for international organizations such as General Electric (GE), Proctor & Gamble (P & G), J.P. Morgan Chase and Verizon Wireless.

Made up of around twelve employees and freelancers, Manu’s team caters to mid-sized companies with limited budgets that are looking for affordable IT solutions. His company offers a wide range of services, including web hosting and design, telecom services and more. Networking, hardware and software are some of their products.

The funds from this loan will assist Manu in expanding his business and moving from a leased to an owned space. Manu hopes to build greater visibility by moving to this independent building, and to build more contact relationships with neighborhood businesses.

loans.use: to move an experienced information technology (IT) company into its own space.

loans.name: Pedro Sanchez

texts.en:
Originally from Peru, Pedro moved to Elizabeth, New Jersey in 1994. He has been working with computers since he was 18 years old, but started his own computer repair business five years ago.

Though he has never attended college, Pedro prides himself on being self-taught, by reading various technical books and independently practicing his skills. He even went to Peru for a specialized training in welding and computer repair. Pedro invests not only in his technical skills, but his business ones; he realizes the importance of actively learning English and takes classes to improve his language skills.

Pedro likes to repair computers, but more than that, he enjoys helping the people in his community. He wants to offer an affordable service, and he has successfully done so, building his customer base to a substantial 4,000 people.

Pedro’s dream is to open his own store, fixing and reselling computers in Elizabeth. The funds from this loan will be used for rent for the store, for supplies, such as a table and monitor, and for advertising the new location.

loans.use: to cover the rent for the store, purchase of supplies, and advertising for his computer repair business.

loans.name: Elida

texts.en:
Elida is 30 years old and she is now applying for a loan of $1,200 to improve her business. 

She is married and has seven children. She opened her kiosk in 2000 with her own working capital of $100. She earns a good income from her business.
 
She will use her loan to buy some stock to keep in her store, such as shirts, long pants, shorts, long and short sleeved tops, childrens clothes and adult clothes. 

She is a very hard working woman and this business has been her regular activity for the past 13 years. She wants to make her business bigger and improve her living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Gina works hard to support her family.

She has a trisikad transportation business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Gina is borrowing PHP 5,500 through NWTF in order to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

Gina has sustained her business activities through her previous six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her trisikad.

loans.name: Meliza

texts.en:
Meliza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling goods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell for her business.

Meliza has been in this business for 7 years. Meliza also earns income from raising pigs.

Meliza has sustained her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her food-vending business.

Myra has been in this business for 38 years. Myra earns additional income from a beauty parlor.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients.

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 41 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Beverly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Beverly has been farming rice for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 61 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Letecia has a hardware business in the Philippines. Letecia requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more hardware stock for her store.

Letecia has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Letecia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware stock for her store.

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Clarissa works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Clarissa is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase more ingredients to sell in her food vending business.

Clarissa has sustained her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more ingredients to sell

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is 62 years old, married and resident of Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Norte, Philippines. Her husband is a fisherman.They have four children who are all married. Starting with capitalization of 5,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in September 2008 and has taken out twelve loans. 

Now she is applying for 14,900 PHP to buy additional stock for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to restock her store with goods like soft drinks, canned goods, soap and other basic commodities.

location.town: Sindangan - Tabon, Jose Dalman, Zamboanga del Nort

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is married and has 3 children. She is 50 years old and resides at Dinas, Sinacaban, Philippines. 

She manages a farm, planting vegetables as an aid to her husband's income, also from farming. 

Her previous loan from GDMPC was used for farm inputs and was successfully repaid. She requests a new loan to cover the costs of weeding and plowing a new plot. I

In the future, Esterlita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover the costs of weeding and plowing

loans.name: Erilda

texts.en:
Erilda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Erilda has been in this business for 20 years. Erilda earns additional income from food-vending.

Erilda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Florita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Florita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials for her fishing business.

Florita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net and other fishing materials.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 52 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by pig-fattening in the Philippines. Leonora is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Leonora has been pig-fattening for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to  save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Munkhkhuyag

texts.en:
Mr. Munkhkhuyag, 43 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a security officer at a petroleum supply agency since 2011. 

His eldest daughter studies at university and still didn't pay her tuition fees. So he is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to pay for his daughter's tuition fees. He thinks the best thing he can do for his daughter is invest in her education which will help her later in life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Lorgen

texts.en:
Lorgen, age 39, is happy tending her little store. She is married with three children. The store is her means of earning a living and supporting her family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Lorgen, keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Lorgen believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Lorgen has reached her first year as a member of Paglaum MPC. She has applied for a loan of PHP 3,500 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the label of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock such as noodles, soft drinks and canned goods.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old and lives in Western Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with only one child. 

Helen runs a mini-grocery store for a living. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional inventory for her mini-grocery store.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Helen hopes to venture into other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her mini-grocery store.

loans.name: Susie

texts.en:
Susie is 42 years old and married with two children. With one child still in school, Susie works very hard to provide for them.

Susie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, etc. in her general store.

Susie has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, bath soap, shampoo, etc. 

Susie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, soft-drinks, laundry soap, bath soap and shampoo.

loans.name: Nelsy

texts.es:
Nelsy es una joven de 25 años de edad la cual es madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y no estudian. Ella es una joven que a muy temprana edad aprendió a trabajar la tierra gracias a sus padres quienes la instruyeron en dicho rubro y posteriormente siguió en práctica con su difunto esposo el cual murió hace muy poco tiempo. La tierra que ella trabaja es propia gracias a una herencia de sus padres los cuales le han apoyado siempre el todo lo necesario posible. Una de las dificultades que ella prioriza y combate cada vez que puede es la alza de precios sobre los insumos que se utilizan en la caficultura como los fertilizantes, abono, foliares entre otros y posteriormente el acarreo del mismo hasta la zona donde ella habita como también la baja de precios en el mercado local e internacional del café ya que la competencia no es un problema. 
Como madre ella sueño con ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales con carreras universitarias que ayuden a fortalecer mediante un trabajo o el emprendimiento de una empresa la economía en cada uno de sus hogares. Como meta ella quiere comprar una despulpadora y un pedazo mas de tierra para poder seguir con los sueños de poder ser la mejor productora de café de la zona. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita un financiamiento con el cual mejorara sus cultivos dando una mejor asistencia aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades.
texts.en:
Nelsy is a young mother of 25 who has two young children who don't yet study.  She learned to work the land from a very young age from her parents, who taught her the ropes. She continued this work with her husband, who passed away recently. The land she works is her own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents, who have always supported her in everything she needs as much as possible. 

One of the main problems she fights against whenever she can is the increase in price of the inputs used to grow coffee, such as fertilizers, compost, foliar products and others, and later, transport to the area where she lives, and the fall in prices in the local and international coffee market, because competition is not a problem.

As a mother, she dreams of seeing her children become professionals with university degrees, which  help them, through a job or a business, have a strong family income. Her aim is to buy a pulper and another plot of land, so that she can foster her dream of being the biggest coffee producer in the area. 

This is why she is requesting a loan with which to improve her crops, nourishing them with agricultural inputs such as compost, fertilizer, coffee grower's formula, and to fungicides to protect against pests and plagues.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee plants.

loans.name: Rancho Loma Bonita Group

texts.es: El grupo “Rancho Loma Bonita” está ubicado en una comunidad muy bonita y tranquila para llegar a ella solo es en transporte público, enseguida esta el negocio de los integrantes del grupo aunque para llegar a su casa esta mucho más lejos ellos también tiene un pequeño ranchito donde tienen varios animales, el nombre del grupo lo eligieron precisamente porque les gusta mucho el lugar donde viven porque viven en un ranchito y el lugar donde está ubicado es en una lomita. Doña Guadalupe o Lupita, como mejor la conocen, es integrante del grupo ella tiene 55 años de edad está casada con el señor Adán desde hace 30 años juntos han formado una familia con dos hijos pero ya son independientes.
